The Govt. of India has recognized VIT as No. 1 Private Institution for Innovation, ARIIA 2019, and the recent recognition, as an Institution of Eminence, has paved a way to focus more on research with international collaborations to move up in the global ranking and contribute in the capacity building of our nation. placement@vitbhopal.ac.in +91/0 75 6025 502 admissions@vitbhopal.ac.in +91/0 7560350900 / 901 / 902 cw@vitbhopal.ac.in warden.lh@vitbhopal.ac.in

title: ABOUT US - VIT Bhopal
content: VIT Bhopal University, envisioned with a new global outlook will empower its aspirants to attain excellence through learning. The comprehensive teaching methodology designed by the University, rede nes the approach to learning, educating and building knowledge-based societies in the country. Collaboration with reputed national and international organisations and strategic partnerships with universities around the world are being established, to prepare a globally competent generation of professionals. We at VIT University will impart futuristic technical education and instil high patterns of discipline through our dedicated staff, who shall set global standards, making our students technologically superior and ethically strong, who in turn shall improve the quality of life of the human race. Our mission is to educate students from all over India, including those from the local and rural areas, and from other countries, so that they become enlightened individuals, improving the living standards of their families, industry and society. We will provide individual attention, world-class quality education and take care of character building. The culturally diverse student community is trained to develop appropriate technologies to address socially relevant issues that align with the Nation s self-sustainability and development initiatives. VIT Bhopal University led by Founder and Chancellor Dr. G Viswanathan, has been established with a vision to create technically skilled young minds at the heart of India. Vice-President Mr. Sankar Viswanathan, and Assistant Vice-President Ms. Kadhambari S Viswanathan, have pioneered this important milestone for VIT, by setting up the University in Madhya Pradesh to cater to the growing demand for quality higher education in India under the able administration of Vice-Chancellor(I/c) Dr. Senthil Kumar Arumugam. placement@vit.ac.in +91 75 6025 502 admissions@vitbhopal.ac.in +91 75 6025 4500 / 501 wardenmh@vitbhopal.ac.in wardenlh@vitbhopal.ac.in

title: LEADERSHIP - VIT Bhopal
content: Dr. G. Viswanathan founded Vellore Engineering College in 1984 at Vellore. He envisioned that this Institution would offer World-Class Education to students who would in turn create an indelible impact on the society. The engineering college that started with an intake of 180 students in 1984 has evolved as a university with four Read More Mr. Sankar Viswanathan, Vice President was born on 13th April 1966. He completed his Advanced Diploma in Engineering Technology, at Chisholm Institute, Melbourne, Australia. He has held honoured positions as the Chairman, and Vice-Chairman of Vellore Engineering College, Vellore before taking over charge as the Pro-Chancellor (Academic) at VIT. He has also served as the Secretary of the North Arcot Educational & Charitable Trust of Vellore. He has always been a very proactive person and has involved himself in all the activities of the University. He has always evinced a keen involvement with the VIT family. He is an active member of the Board of Management, VIT and displays a keen interest in the affairs of the college and being a student friendly person is avidly interested in the academic progress of the students and staff Read More Ms. Kadhambari S. Viswanathan has been instrumental in influencing the educational landscape at VIT. In her role as the next generation of educational leadership, Ms. Viswanathan is advancing the robust foundation established by Dr. G. Viswanathan, the distinguished founder and Chancellor of VIT, whose innovative contributions have elevated VIT to a status of global prominence in the fields of learning and research... Read More Prof. T. B. Sridharan graduated in 1991 from the University of Madras and earned his master s in Zoology (Entomology) from Annamalai University in 1994. He joined as a JRF (Medical Entomologist) in the Defence Research and Development Establishment (DRDE) in Gwalior and has completed his PhD (1998) in neurobiology of sensory organs in insects (Dr Shri Prakash s Lab). His doctoral thesis involves collaborative research work of DRDE Gwalior with Prof. R. Naresh Singh, Molecular Biology (Head) Unit, Tata Institute of Fundamental Research (TIFR) Navy Mumbai. Read More

title: Schools List - VIT Bhopal
content: VIT Bhopal has made a mark in higher education as one of the best engineering institutes in Central India. The Institute hosts 8 Schools offering academic and research-oriented engineering and management courses both at undergraduate and post-graduate levels. The prospective students can opt for any school, based on their area of interest and future career goals. At VIT Bhopal, research plays an imperative role on par with academics, facilitating interdepartmental collaborations, besides providing ample opportunities for the students to keep themselves updated of the technological advancements and innovations. All the schools are equipped with state of the art laboratories to impart practical knowledge as per the current industrial standards. The School of Advanced Sciences and Languages is a center of research and teaching in the study of Science, English Language and Literature, Linguistics, Economics and Social Sciences. The school aims to instantiate the interaction of Natural Science with society and culture, language in particular, and other disciplines of Humanities. It offers numerous core and elective courses, developed in collaboration with academic and industrial experts. Read More School of Biosciences, Engineering and Technology contemplates the application of science and the principles of engineering in biology and biomedical engineering. The center trains the students to address the medical and biological problems. The school offers a set of core and elective courses which help students gain knowledge about the real world problems through holistic learning. The courses offer a blend of diverse knowledge of science, engineering and technology to solve real world problems of environment and health. Read More The SCOPE aims at leveraging the power of innovative digital technology and tech-enabled solutions to support better learning and living experiences for aspirants in computing science and interactive media technologies. Our programs are future-ready and forward- looking, and equip the students with a career at the forefront of innovation. The school will continue to successfully develop future-ready engineers in various domains of computing science and interactive media technologies to provide innovative solutions to the Volatile, Uncertain, Complex, and Ambiguous (VUCA) World. Read More The School of Computing Science Engineering and Artificial Intelligence (SCAI) has started in 2024 with eleven programmes, including five under graduate, five post graduate programmes and one doctoral programme. The school has the students strength of 6243. The SCAI school is enriched with future ready programmes on Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, Cyber Security, Health Informatics, Cloud Computing and E-Commerce. These programmes are designed to cater the needs of the recent technological advancements that will be attracting the industry job market and cutting edge research in the computer science field. Read More The School of Mechanical Engineering offers opportunities for students to acquire knowledge in the domains of Machine Design, Thermal & Fluid Sciences, Manufacturing Engineering, and Aerospace engineering. The school offers a carefully constructed curriculum designed after detailed consultation with industry experts. Read More The VIT Business School offers specializations in various functional areas of management to prepare students in their quest to explore unlimited career opportunities. They are offered core and elective courses from a varied range of streams namely Economics, Law, Finance, Human Resource Management, and Computer Applications. The knowledge acquired will in turn equip them with the competency to make prudent decisions to support existing businesses or create novel business opportunities. Read More The School of Electrical and Electronics Engineering aims to hone students in the field of Signal Processing, Communication, Control Systems, Power Systems, VLSI, and numerous other domains. The well-equipped laboratories give students a taste of the real-world scenarios and equips them with skills to efficiently create viable solutions for real-time problems. Read More School of Architecture VIT Bhopal is committed to play a leading role in architectural practice, by being regionally sensitive and globally aware, through a critical discourse of architectural theory, Animated and Computer technologies associated with Designing, Developing, Practical, Professional, Intensive Fieldwork, Knowledge sharing Critique, and Debates. School of Architecture formulates the success in constant learning, practicing, e-learning, lab testing, field testing, and exchange programs leading to continuous excellence in students confidence and knowledge. Demystifying the Gap within Theory and Profession is the key indicator of the whole Curriculum designed so that students pass through all steps of development; think, learn, design, share, practice, present and achieve.s. Read More

title: FFCS - VIT Bhopal
content: VIT, the name synonymous with world class academic excellence and for creating a student-friendly learning environment on all its campuses, has introduced Fully Flexible Credit System (FFCS), for the benefit of its students. Carefully crafted and designed towards providing amazing advantages for the next generation Engineers and Researchers, FFCS offers total freedom for the students to customise their course, depending on their interests even while catering to the wish list. Under FFCS, a student can prepare his/her own timetable with the specific courses he/she intends to do in that semester along with the timings of classes and choice of professors. Voila! Learning has never been this fun! FFCS paves a way for the pupils to not only gain knowledge in their interesting subjects but also provides ample time and opportunities to pursue their other interests like sports or club activities. In addition, this system ensures multi-disciplinary curriculum, encouraging students to gain intense knowledge, deeper insights in to varied topics. The students can design their own timetable helping them pursue various future ready courses in addition to core courses. This also gives them better time management to pursue interests in other areas like cultural activities, sports, etc. VIT Bhopal Semester Abroad Programme aims to encourage students from all programmes to pursue a semester in one of the reputed international universities abroad, and the credits earned are transferred. The students with the help of faculty in the respective areas can audit courses in accordance with their performance, interests, career plans at regular intervals. If needed, the students are at the liberty to add few more topics as a part of their learning. The First Year B.Tech students can avail an option of migrating in to other disciplines. For instance, if a student joined in Mechanical Engineering but would like to change into other discipline by the end of first year, he or she can do it by all means, subject to certain rules. It is a unique feature which will enable students to choose Summer Semester or an Interim Semester for early completion of courses and the academic year. It will provide ample time and opportunities for the students to prepare for job interviews, project works and for higher studies. ITP is offered by the university where the students can opt for completing the degree from a reputed international university based on credits earned during the first two years of their bachelor s degree in VIT. Students are at the liberty to customize their courses by adding or doing away with subjects. The faculty will guide the pupils in designing their tailor-made curriculum based on their interests, expertise in the relevant areas and especially on the career goals. An inter-disciplinary project work designed to enable students towards first-hand understanding of the societal issues. This helps students identify real-life problems faced by rural and urban India and encourages them to come out with solutions that would help the society at large. Read More The students can choose interdisciplinary courses and attain Honours or a Minors degree, depending on the curriculum. The selection of such programme keeps them at par with the changing trends of industry and their own interest giving them edge in their careers in future.

title: Controller of Examinations - VIT Bhopal
content: The Office of the Controller of Examinations is responsible for preparation, scheduling, and conduct of Term End Examinations (TEE) for all the programmes offered by the University. It also facilitates central valuation of answer scripts and timely publication of Results. The other responsibilities are:

title: International Relations - VIT Bhopal
content: VIT Bhopal University has the advantage of the best International Relations built by the VIT group over the years. The International Relations opportunities are common for all VIT campuses. Our International Relations Office coordinates collaborative academic programs with foreign universities. These encompass both bachelor-level (2+2 program) and integrated master-level (3.5+1.5 program) offerings, enabling students to embark on a portion of their academic journey at prestigious global institutions, ultimately earning degrees from these esteemed establishments. Our Semester Abroad Program (SAP) encourages VIT Bhopal students, across all disciplines, to spend their final semester at one of our esteemed partner universities abroad. This enriching experience enables students to engage with world-leading research laboratories and gain exposure to cutting-edge research and academic environments. Furthermore, faculty and student exchange programs between foreign universities and VIT Bhopal foster cross-cultural knowledge sharing. These exchanges bring international professors and researchers to our campus, allowing our students to interact with and learn from global academic leaders. The IR office of VIT bhopal actively disseminates information regarding internship and scholarship opportunities worldwide, helping students secure prestigious scholarships such as Erasmus Mundus and Finnish scholarships. These initiatives underscore our commitment to empowering students for success on the global stage. Join us for an exciting talk by Dr. Pavan Turaga from Arizona State University on Geometric approaches in computer vision and generative AI Date: 9th August, Friday Time: 8:30 AM via Zoom Dr. Turaga, a leader in computer vision and machine learning research, will share his insights and latest advancements in these transformative fields. This is a fantastic opportunity for students, faculty, and anyone interested in technology and innovation. VIT Bhopal University has inked exclusive Memoranda of Understanding (MoUs) with seven prestigious universities recently to strengthen collaboration in research, joint academic programs, semester abroad opportunities, internships, and knowledge exchange in the domains of aerospace, bioengineering, and computer science. These partnerships signify a concerted effort to enhance educational and research initiatives while providing students with valuable global exposure and hands-on experiences in these cutting-edge fields. This significant collaboration was formalized through the signing ceremony, presided over by the esteemed Assistant Vice President VIT Bhopal and Pro Vice Chancellor of Cranfield University, Professor Dame Helen Atkinson. In attendance was also the presence of Professor Suresh Sampath, Head of Gas Turbine Systems Engineering and Operations Group at the Centre for Propulsion and Thermal Power Engineering, Cranfield University. This strengthened MoU marks a pivotal moment in the ongoing collaboration between Cranfield University and VIT Bhopal. The comprehensive nature of this agreement fosters a seamless transition for students, providing them with a unique opportunity to commence their advanced studies at one of the leading institutions globally. The MoU establishes a framework for cooperation between our institutions in several key areas, including: Student and Faculty Exchanges, Joint Research Projects and Conferences. Located in Braga, Portugal, the University of Minho is renowned for its academic excellence and innovative research. It offers a wide range of programs and has a strong commitment to fostering international partnerships. We look forward to the fruitful relationship with the University of Minho and the opportunities it will create for our university community. VIT Bhopal Signs MoU with IPSA Paris: A New Horizon in Aerospace Engineering We are thrilled to announce that VIT Bhopal University has signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with IPSA Paris (Institut Polytechnique des Sciences Avanc es), one of France s leading institutions specializing in aerospace engineering. Established in 1961, IPSA is known for its expertise in aeronautics and space technology and a key hub for aerospace innovation in Europe. IPSA offers a specialized curriculum that covers every aspect of aerospace engineering, from aircraft design to space exploration technologies. IPSA has a strong tradition of innovation and research, contributing significantly to advancements in aerospace science and engineering. Together, VIT Bhopal and IPSA Paris will work to foster innovation and knowledge sharing, strengthening ties between India and France in the aerospace sector. title: Library - VIT Bhopal
content: The VIT Bhopal Central library has been established with state-of-art infrastructure to the International Standards, spreads over to Two Floors. It has provided Reference Section, Reading Section, well-protected with fire alarm, CCTV, and Flap Barrier. The library subscribes to national and international journals in electronic version and print. Reference and Textbooks of national and international authors, International and National Journals & Non-Book materials are available to cater various fields of Basic Sciences, Engineering and Technology, Architecture, Aeronautical, Aerospace Books, biotechnology Languages, General Books, Fashion Technology, Humanities, Social Sciences and management ranging from printed books, e-books, and back volumes. VIT Bhopal Library has a Digital library, Video Conferencing facility. Central Library is using Koha software for Library automation and has implemented RFID technology with self-issue and return kiosk, WEB-OPAC (Online Public Access Catalogue), and online renewal facility. The library has a video conferencing facility other E-Learning resources initiated by the Government of India. The library is fully automated with the web centric integrated library management system (KOHA 19.05) with Biometric and RFID technology with self-issue and return kiosk, WEB-OPAC (Online Public Access Catalogue), and online renewal facility. Know More VIT Bhopal Central Library is maintains our faculties and scholars resources in association with Shodhganga, VIDWAN , INDCAT, IRINS Indian Research Information Networking System. https://shodhganga.inflibnet.ac.in/ (Repository of Indian theses and dissertation- Open Access) https://vidwan.inflibnet.ac.in/ VIDWAN is the premier database of profiles of scientists/researchers and other faculty members working at leading academic institutions and other R & D organisation involved in teaching and research in India. Repository of Indian Research in Progress details. Synopses/Research Proposals for Ph.D. programme. https://shodhgangotri.inflibnet.ac.in/ The Union databases of various library resources https://indcat.inflibnet.ac.in http://irins.org/irins/ IRINS is web-based Research Information Management (RIM) service developed by the Information and Library Network (INFLIBNET) Centre in collaboration with the Central University of Punjab. The portal facilitates the academic, R&D organisations and faculty members, scientists to collect, curate and showcase the scholarly communication activities and provide an opportunity to create the scholarly network. The IRINS is available as free software-as-service to the academic and R&D organisations in India. Under the Digital India mission, Indian Government has created nation s first and largest multilingual dictionary, access to which is completely online namely Bharatvani. We can able to translate words from 22 different languages and in the forthcoming days, Government aims to add 100 more languages into the platform and it was implemented by the Central Institute of Indian Languages (CIIL), Mysore. http://bharatavani.in/ Under Open Knowledge movement, this dictionary will be the single point reference for understanding and learning various languages of India. It has been hailed as the first and largest multilingual dictionary in India. Using technology, Government will protect and nurture the regional languages from India, and enable easy access to the online tools for learning them. Such online dictionary will help India to foster national integration . This first initiative of Indian Govt. to encapsulate regional languages will help Indian technology companies to integrate regional languages into their products and creations. BharatVani App also launched of this dictionary, which can be downloaded from Google Playstore. Anyone can create own account in seconds. URL : http://bharatavani.in/ Disabled User Friendly Services (DIVYANGJAN) Assistive Technology (AT) and facilities (Human Assistance) for the persons with disability/physically challenged. The Central Library provides user-friendly services to our physically challenged users in all aspects such as provision of wheel chair, help in finding or locating the library resources WEB-OPAC, retrieving the required materials, renewing and returning of books by the library staff assistance. There is a separate user friendly rest room for them. Digital Delivery Services: Mobile app is available for all accessing of online databases/e-Journals. In this app there is a facility called Listen TTS. It reads aloud the PDF files. The disability users will use this facility with the support of library staff (human assistance) for listening the research articles. The Union databases of various library resources. https://indcat.inflibnet.ac.in Mendeley Reference Management Software tool designed for managing references and bibliographies in academic writing. The User Guide (Download) Mendeley refers to a downloadable manual that provides instructions on how to use Mendeley s features effectively for organizing research, collaborating with others, and formatting citations. All students, faculty members and staff of the institute are membership of the library First Floor Circulation Kiosk Return Kiosk, Multi Touch Table, Office for Librarian & Asst. Librarian. Reading Hall, Digital Library, Technical Section, Video Conferencing room, Discussion Room & Library OPAC. Second Floor Reference Section Reading Hall, Digital Library, Journal Section, Discussion Rooms, Photocopier Section, Media Resource / NPTEL Centre and Library Server Room, Office for Prof. In charge Library, Stack area, PhD Thesis, CD Section. Lab Complex LC 204 Reference Section, Reading Hall, Digital Library. Note: The above rules are intended to regulate the best use of Library resources and will be reviewed periodically to meet the changing needs. Any changes in the rules or instructions or information to members will be notified on the Library Notice Board as and when required.

title: vitbhopal-blogs - VIT Bhopal
content: VIT Bhopal has emerged as one of the best engineering Institutes in Central India which offers new innovative under graduate and post graduate courses to keep pace with the changing technology scenario. The futuristic infrastructure, novel teaching learning methodologies, excellent academics have added to the accomplishments. VIT Bhopal assures its students an exposure to cutting edge technology and provides them with immense career opportunities in terms of better placements in India and abroad, or gives them opportunities to pursue higher education in the top ranked universities of the world. Envisioning the best for every student, by giving them the VIT edge and providing every student a place to learn and a chance to grow; is the main goal of VIT Bhopal. The educational experience is enriched by the cultural diversity, with faculty and students, hailing from different parts of the country. This blog section brings forth various updates from our Institute, in order to acquaint about the need based industry relevant B.Tech, M.Tech and other courses offered, the current trends in technology and the unique features of VIT Bhopal. The blogs apprise of the new opportunities, new perspectives and the best practices that can motivate, inspire and trigger your curiosities. In the current pandemic situation, stay at home; stay safe and go through our very informative blogs to get familiar with the prevalent technologies and VIT Bhopal.

title: dsw chapters - VIT Bhopal
content: At VIT Bhopal University, the VIT Chapters serve as dynamic platforms that cater to specific interests and domains, allowing students to delve deeper into their areas of passion. Each chapter focuses on a specialized field, such as technical, cultural, or academic domains, offering students unique opportunities to explore and excel. These chapters are student-led and affiliated with renowned national and international organizations, providing valuable resources and exposure to students. Through a wide array of events, workshops, competitions, and seminars, VIT Chapters empower students to enhance their knowledge, skills, and expertise in their respective fields. Whether it s the ACM Student Chapter for computer enthusiasts, the Material Advantage Student Chapter for those keen on materials science, or the TEDx VIT Bhopal Chapter inspiring through impactful ideas, each VIT Chapter plays a significant role in shaping a well-rounded and thriving campus experience. One of the major initiatives of the Computer Society of India is to serve the student community by bridging the gap between academia and industry. CSI Student Chapter promotes various activities among their student branches such as seminars, workshops, conferences, symposium, quiz competition, project competition and many more. Also conducts various quality training programs for students as well as for faculties. Dr. K Murugweshwari (100256) murugeswari.k2021@vitbhopal.ac.in GeeksforGeeks VITB is a subset of GeeksforGeeks which provides an opportunity for students of VIT BHOPAL to connect with others who share their interests in computer science and programming and learn and grow together in a supportive and collaborative environment. GeeksforGeeks VITB s main focus is to help students to learn from experts, discuss technical topics with their peers, collaborate on various computer science and programming-related topics, and work on projects together. Dr. Jitendra Pratap Singh Mathur (100526) jitendrapratapsinghmathur@vitbhopal.ac.in At IEEE VIT Bhopal Student Branch, we prioritize uniqueness of our student partners development by providing a dynamic platform for collaboration, skill enhancement, and leadership in the ever-evolving world of engineering and technology. Dr. Ankur Beohar (100158) ankur.beohar@vitbhopal.ac.in NULL VIT Bhopal Student Chapter is the student chapter of the Null Community, focused on spreading information security awareness. We provide knowledge related to the field of information security through various means. As a volunteer- driven community, we are open, professional, inclusive, and responsible. Dr. Subhash Chandra Patel(100194) subhash.patel@vitbhopal.ac.in nullchapter@vitbhopal.ac.in The mission of Omdena chapter is to promote real-world AI through running open-source projects, providing case study-based education and AI services to local AI enthusiasts and businesses around the world. Dr. A V R Mayuri (100255) mayuri.avr@vitbhopal.ac.in Students for the Exploration and Development of Space (SEDS) is a global organization of which SEDS Nebula is a chapter. Our vision is to unite people from different disciplines. We have departments like events, projects and out reach. Our projects involve working on space related problems using innovative methods. We conduct events to unite people with all talents, interests and passions amd come together. Our outreach events are aimed to not just teach young talents but also to learn about space and its mysteries. Dr. Nella Anvesh Kumar (100098) nella.anveshkumar@vitbhopal.ac.in SIAM Students Chapter VIT Bhopal aims to equip students with the necessary skills and expertise essential to excel in diverse fields of applied mathematics, ranging from computer science to forensic science and cryptography. This student chapter facilitates an experiential learning environment that empowers students to translate classroom knowledge into practical applications through projects, research, industry consultations, and apprenticeships. The chapter s reach is all-encompassing as it is a division in the university that spans across all academic branches. With a commitment to academic excellence and experiential learning, SIAM VIT Bhopal stands as a pioneering force in shaping the future of applied mathematics. Dr. Pon Harshvardhana (100122) pon.harshavardhanan@vitbhopal.ac.in TEDx VIT Bhopal is a passionate group dedicated to spreading ideas worth sharing and creating a platform for impactful conversations within our community. As a TEDx chapter, we aim to inspire and motivate students by bringing together speakers from diverse backgrounds who have experienced remarkable journeys of success. Our events feature live speakers and recorded TED talks, allowing students to learn from the insights and experiences of exceptional individuals. Through TEDx, we foster a spirit of open-mindedness and curiosity, encouraging students to explore various interdisciplinary domains and embrace new perspectives. Join us in this exciting journey of discovery, as we bring the TEDx spirit to VIT Bhopal and create a community that thrives on the power of ideas. Together, let s ignite the spark of inspiration and learning at TEDx VIT Bhopal!. Dr. Pushpdant Jain (100210) pushpdant.jain@vitbhopal.ac.in The Toastmasters International-VITB Chapter is dedicated to fostering a supportive and engaging environment where members can enhance their public speaking, communication, and leadership skills. Through structured learning, interactive sessions, and constructive feedback, we empower individuals to develop confidence, articulate their ideas effectively, and become inspiring leaders. Our objective is to: Cultivate effective communication and persuasive speaking skills. Foster leadership development through club roles and mentorship. Provide a safe and encouraging platform for self-improvement. Enhance critical thinking and active listening abilities. Create a collaborative learning community that nurtures personal and professional growth. At VITB Toastmasters, we believe in the power of words and the strength of leadership, shaping individuals into confident speakers and future-ready professionals. Dr. K. Murugeswar(100256) murugeswari.k@vitbhopal.ac.in vitbtoastmasters@vitbhopal.ac.in The VIT Bhopal ACM Student Chapter is a part of the prestigious Association for Computing Machinery (ACM), fostering a vibrant community of computer science enthusiasts. Our chapter provides a platform for students to engage in cutting-edge research, technology trends, and industry insights. Through workshops, seminars, coding competitions, and hackathons, we empower members to excel in various domains of computer science and technology. Join us to connect with like-minded individuals, network with industry professionals, and explore the endless possibilities of computing at the VIT Bhopal ACM Student Chapter. Let s together shape the future of technology!. Dr. Sandeep Monga(100677) sandeepmonga@vitbhopal.ac.in The Material Advantage Student Chapter at VIT Bhopal University established under the guidance of Dr. S Balaguru, our chapter aims to enrich the knowledge of materials for Mechanical, Robotics, and Aerospace Engineering students. As members of this chapter, you gain access to four prestigious international societies, namely ASM International, Association for Iron & Steel Technology (AIST), American Ceramic Society (ACerS), and The Minerals, Metals & Materials Society (TMS). Through these societies, you receive scientific brochures and valuable resources, enhancing your understanding of materials and their applications. Join us to become part of this dynamic community, exploring the vast world of materials science and engineering at the Material Advantage Student Chapter!. Dr. S Balaguru (100217) balaguru.s@vitbhopal.ac.in Women in Cyber Security (WiCyS) is the premier organization with international reach dedicated to bringing together women in cybersecurity from academia, research and industry to share knowledge, experience, networking and mentoring. Dr. Krishna Chouhan (10606) krishnachauhan@vitbhopal.ac.in Director Students Welfare Office # Ground Floor (Near Auditorium) Academic Block VIT Bhopal University E.Mail: swc@vitbhopal.ac.in

title: dsw teams - VIT Bhopal
content: The Office of Students Welfare at VIT Bhopal University is supported by a dedicated team of faculty members who play crucial roles in ensuring the well-being and overall development of our students. These faculty members work tirelessly to create a supportive and enriching environment for our students, ensuring their academic success and personal growth during their time at VIT Bhopal University. They are dedicated to promoting student welfare, discipline, and a sense of community on our campus. dsw@vitbhopal.ac.in ad2.sw@vitbhopal.ac.in ad1.sw@vitbhopal.ac.in ad.proctor@vitbhopal.ac.in swc@vitbhopal.ac.in Email-sportsofficer@vitbhopal.ac.in Seating -Block 1,Ground Floor, Boys Hostel Cabin No.-AB1-511 Email:counsellor@vitbhopal.ac.in

title: dsw campus events - VIT Bhopal
content: VIT Bhopal University is a hive of activity, with a diverse range of campus events organized by the Office of Students Welfare. These events encompass academic seminars, cultural festivals, technical symposiums, sports meets, and the annual Techno-Cultural fest, AdVITya. They offer students opportunities for learning, cultural enrichment, and friendly competition, fostering a dynamic and engaging campus environment. These events exemplify our commitment to a holistic educational experience that nurtures both the mind and spirit of our students. AdVITya is VIT Bhopal University s annual flagship festival, a vibrant celebration of creativity, talent, and enthusiasm. This event, deeply rooted in tradition and innovation, has been a cherished tradition at the university. It brings together students from diverse backgrounds, offering a platform to showcase their talents, participate in exciting competitions, and experience the joy of cultural exchange. AdVITya embodies the spirit of VIT Bhopal, fostering a sense of unity and camaraderie among students. It s a vibrant and unforgettable experience that reflects the dynamism and creativity of the university community. Magazine: [ https://vitbhopal.ac.in/file/2023/05/Advitya-2023-Magazine.pdf ] Aftermovie: [VIT | Bhopal | Harmony Unveiled: A Cinematic Journey through our University Fest adVITya 2023 ] Magazine: [ https://vitbhopal.ac.in/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/AdVITya-2025-Magazine.pdf ] The Robotics Workshop, a collaborative endeavor between the Electric Vehicle Club of VIT Bhopal and the Techfest, Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Bombay, unfolded on September 15, 2023, at the VIT Bhopal University Auditorium. This enlightening event marked the convergence of experts and enthusiasts, providing a platform for an immersive exploration of robotics. Participants had the invaluable opportunity to build and program robots under the guidance of experienced mentors, deepening their understanding and equipping them with essential practical skills. The core of the workshop featured technical sessions delivered by experts from both institutions, covering a broad spectrum of topics, from robotics fundamentals to programming and practical applications across industries. A thought-provoking panel discussion on the future of robotics and emerging trends added a dynamic dimension to the event, fostering vibrant exchanges of ideas among participants and experts alike. This workshop left attendees with enriched knowledge of robotics, hands-on experience in robot building and programming, and expanded professional networks. Moreover, it raised awareness of the collaborative efforts between the Electric Vehicle Club of VIT Bhopal and IIT Bombay, laying the foundation for continued knowledge-sharing and cooperation in the field of robotics. Organized by: Electric Vehicle Club Faculty Coordinators: Mr. Ajay Sharma | Mr. Rajneesh Kumar Patel Student Coordinator: Mukesh Kumar Ghosh VIT Bhopal s Ice-breaking event for the incoming batch of 2023 commenced with great enthusiasm from 12th to 15th September 2023. The event s primary participants were the newest members of our academic family, the freshers of 2023. They were welcomed with open arms and warm smiles by the entire VIT community, ensuring that their college journey began with excitement and camaraderie. The outcomes of this event exceeded mere introductions; it forged lasting friendships and created unforgettable memories. Through engaging activities and games, freshers interacted and connected. They laughed during games like Dumb-charades, tested their knowledge with Guess the Famous Dialogues, and danced their hearts out during Music and Dance Switch. These activities, spread over four days, melted the ice and built bridges that would connect these students throughout their academic years. The Ice-breaking event of 2023 was a stage for the freshers to thrive and make the most of their college experience. This four-day extravaganza served as a memorable initiation into college life, skillfully organized under the guidance of the Director Students Welfare and hosted by the dedicated members of the Student Council along with Student Volunteers. Organized by: Office of Students Welfare Faculty Coordinators: Dr. J. George Chellin Chandran | Dr. Anant Kant Shukla | Dr. Manisha Singh | Dr. Trapti Sharma Student Coordinator: Pranjal Mohan Pandey | Sakalya Mitra The Malayalam Club organized a splendid Onam celebration on September 5th and 6th, 2023 commemorating Kerala s vibrant culture and traditions. The celebrations began on September 5th, with an electrifying flash mob and a traditional Vadamvali (tug of war) contest, exclusively for our students. The evening echoed with the enthusiasm and unity of participants. On September 6th, the festivities commenced with a vibrant Chenda Melam procession, capturing the essence of Kerala s cultural richness. The beats of the Chenda infused energy into the surroundings, creating an atmosphere of joy and anticipation. In the auditorium, a series of cultural performances unfolded, including the graceful Thiruvathira dance, group dances showcasing regional diversity, and an elegant ramp walk. These performances highlighted the talents and traditions of Kerala, captivating the audience. The grand finale of the celebration featured a delectable Onasadhya, a traditional feast comprising 18+ side dishes and the sweet treat of payasam. It was a culinary journey through the flavors of Kerala, representing the heart and soul of Onam. These festivities not only celebrated Onam s spirit but also fostered a sense of cultural unity among our students and participants. Organized by: Malayalam Club Faculty Coordinators: Dr. Prashant G K | Dr. Divya Haridas Student Coordinator: Vismaya Satheesh | Kevin Eby David On August 15, 2023, VIT Bhopal University celebrated India s 77th Independence Day with a touch of creativity, pride, and patriotism. Esteemed guests, including Air Commodore Mrigiinder Siingh VSM (Rtd.), Vice Chancellor (i/c) Dr. Senthil Kumar Arumugam, and Registrar Dr. Pradyumna Yadav, graced the occasion. The day commenced with the raising of the tricolor and the soul-stirring National Anthem. A symbolic act of planting trees by Air Commodore Mrigiinder Siingh and Vice-Chancellor (i/c) Dr. Senthil Kumar Arumugam represented growth and progress. The Academic Block buzzed with a lively parade and a warm reception. The event featured creative highlights such as the prize distribution for the World UFO Day Poster Competition and the felicitation of AVAHAN 23 sports champions. Heartfelt gratitude was extended to the Security and cleaning Personnel for their unwavering dedication, underscoring the unity of purpose. Cultural performances by the Dance Club and Defence Warriors Club teams showcased creativity with powerful anti-ragging and patriotic dances. The Music Club added a melodious touch with a stirring patriotic song, evoking a profound sense of national pride. This Independence Day celebration at VIT Bhopal University hosted by members of the Student Council and student volunteers creatively encapsulated the essence of India s 77th year of freedom, uniting the academic community in a memorable tribute to the nation. Organized by: Office of Students Welfare Faculty Coordinators: Dr. J. George Chellin Chandran | Dr. Chandan Kumar Behera | Dr. Prashant Tiwari Student Coordinator: Pranjal Mohan Pandey | Sahil Chaudhary At BioExpo 23 on August 12, 2023, the captivating world of microbiology came alive through a tapestry of intriguing experiments. Among the highlights was a microscopic voyage into microorganisms thriving in diverse water sources. This illuminating exploration emphasized the paramount significance of water quality for our well-being and the environment. Precise incubation unveiled the secrets hidden within mineral water, filtered water, and drain water, revealing a tapestry of microbial diversity and underscoring the urgency of clean, safe water for public health. Another spotlight was the Gel Electrophoresis experiment, illuminating the prowess of DNA analysis in forensic science. The race of DNA fragments through an electric field, aiding in criminal investigations, showcased the synergy between science and justice. The BioExpo 23 workshop deepened participants microbiological prowess through hands-on experiences. The streaking experiment unraveled the art of bacterial colony isolation, a microbiologist s fundamental skill. Participants mastered the delicate technique of streaking bacterial cultures on agar plates, fostering colony isolation an indispensable skill. The Gram staining experiment empowered attendees with practical knowledge of microbial classification, equipping them to distinguish between bacterial species. Certificates of completion recognized their commitment to expanding their life science horizons. BioExpo 23 and its enriching workshop united education and hands-on practice in the captivating realm of microbiology, where science transforms into discovery. Organized by: The Bioengineering Club Faculty Coordinators: Dr. Neetu Kalra | Dr. Arun Kumar K Student Coordinator: Shreya Dandwate | Amitasha Mishra The Punjabi Club s inaugural event and Bhangra Night on April 12, 2023, drew a diverse audience of students, faculty, and guests. The inaugural event featured spirited Punjabi dance performances, showcasing the rich diversity of Punjabi dance forms. The Bhangra Night that followed was a high-energy extravaganza, featuring electrifying music and mesmerizing Gatka performances. Attendees, adorned in vibrant traditional attire, swayed to the infectious beats of Punjabi music. A delightful Punjabi food festival added flavor to the night, offering delectable dishes like chole bhature, paneer tikka, and lassi, all of which were enthusiastically relished. The event s pinnacle was a spirited Bhangra dance performance by various student and faculty groups, setting a lively tone for the evening. The Punjabi Club s Inaugural Event and Bhangra Night exemplified their dedication to showcasing and celebrating Punjabi culture. The event s organization, performances, cuisine, and festive ambiance were thoroughly enjoyed, fostering unity and cultural appreciation among attendees. Organized by: Punjabi Club Faculty Coordinators: Dr. Pushpinder Singh Patheja Student Coordinator: Mansi Bakhshi | Rhythm Nain Kour The Ram Navami and Gudi Padwa celebrations, organized by the Marathi Club on March 31, 2023, were a vibrant showcase of Indian culture and traditions. These festivities brought together individuals from various backgrounds to celebrate these significant Hindu festivals. The event began with traditional pujas, led by esteemed Assistant Vice President Ms. Kadhambari S. Viswanathan and university officials, symbolizing the start of the Hindu New Year and the birth of Lord Rama. A spirited procession followed, featuring the raising of the Gudi flag, a symbol of victory, and the rhythmic beats of dhol tasha. The celebration was a blend of tradition and modernity, with Lord Rama s songs played by a DJ, creating an energetic atmosphere. Prasad s distribution and expressions of gratitude further enriched the event, fostering a sense of community and unity. This celebration not only honored culture and traditions but also strengthened bonds among students, faculty, and staff, exemplifying the vibrant heritage of India. Organized by: Marathi Club Faculty Coordinators: Dr. Manisha Jain Student Coordinator: Pankaj Patil | Mrunmayee Sakharwade The Sharada 2023: Saraswati Puja celebration, hosted by the Bengali Club at VIT Bhopal on January 27, 2023, attended by around 200 individuals was dedicated to honoring Saraswati, the goddess of knowledge, creativity, and music. The heart of the event was the soulful Saraswati Vandana performed by the passionate Bengali Club students, seeking blessings for wisdom and artistic inspiration. The cultural extravaganza unfolded with mesmerizing solo and ensemble dance performances, showcasing the diverse and rich dance heritage of Bengal. Additionally, Abritti, recitations of literary works, added a poetic dimension to the evening, displaying linguistic and poetic talents. To engage the audience, a Movie Song Trivia competition was organized, fostering enthusiasm and active participation. The event concluded on a high note with a group song performance by the Bengali Club, followed by the distribution of food packets, providing a delightful conclusion to the evening. Sharada 2023 was an unforgettable experience, blending cultural performances, interactive contests, and delectable food, leaving a lasting impression on all who attended. Organized by: Bengali Club Faculty Coordinators: Dr. Soumya Shankar Ghosh | Dr. Pallavi Sarkar Student Coordinator: Mitrashish Basu Roy | Saklya Mitra The Gujarati Club of VIT Bhopal brought the vibrant spirit of Navratri to life with their Garba Night on September 29, 2022. This lively celebration, dedicated to honoring Goddess Ambey and her nine avatars, drew an impressive crowd of over 1,000 participants, including students and faculty of VIT Bhopal University. The event commenced with a traditional Aarti, infusing the festivities with a sacred aura. Amidst the backdrop of students donning exquisite Gujarati attire, the night unfolded with captivating dance performances to the rhythmic beats of Gujarati songs. The energy and enthusiasm were palpable as participants immersed themselves in the joyous Garba dance, creating lasting cultural memories. Organized by: Gujarati Club Faculty Coordinators: Dr. Bhumika Choksi | Dr. Neetu Kalra Student Coordinator: Yash Gorasiya | Harshil Rathod Events Team Director Students Welfare Office # Ground Floor (Near Auditorium) Academic Block VIT Bhopal University E.Mail: events@vitbhopal.ac.in

title: Stars Scheme - VIT Bhopal
content: A Child should never be deprived of quality education because of they are residing in Rural Areas. This forceful thought in the mind of Hon ble Chancellor VIT University became the seed that gave birth to the innovative STARS scheme . This scheme was launched at VIT University Vellore at very first time in 2008 and from that year only all campuses of VIT are carrying that legacy. VIT Bhopal University has also started STARS scheme in Madhya Pradesh as well from the academic year 2019-2020 in order to cater the topper students from rural areas, who have completed their 12th from government schools. The STARS scheme was officially launched in Madhya Pradesh by Dr. G. Vishwanathan Hon ble Chancellor VIT University on May 20th, 2019 . VIT Bhopal Campus is located at Bhopal Indore Highway in Madhya Pradesh: Ms. Kadambari Vishwanathan, Assistant Vice President of VIT Bhopal University has taken decision of initiating the STARS scheme to all 52 Districts of Madhya Pradesh after reviewing the local constraint and level of inadequacy of quality higher education in the state. Under this Scheme One bright Boy and One bright Girl, who topped their District in Higher Secondary Examination from Government School, were offered free higher Education at VIT Bhopal campus in any of the state of art courses/programs at university. like Cyber Security, Artificial Intelligence, Aerospace Engineering, Machine Learning, Bio Engineering, Computer Science besides conventional engineering courses like Mechanical, Electrical & electronics, Electronics & Communication as well as BBA. This year also total 44 students who are district toppers have been admitted under the STARS scheme at VIT Bhopal University. Dr. Abhay Vidyarthi Senior Assistant Professor, VIT Bhopal University, Bhopal-Indore Highway, Kothrikalan, Sehore. Madhya Pradesh 466114. Phone: +91 75 6025 4500 / 501 / 502

title: Diversity - VIT Bhopal
content: Imbibing this philosophy, VIT Bhopal University is committed towards creating a diversity and inclusive community by embracing people from different cultural backgrounds. We recognize the importance of sharing diverse cultural ethics and values among individuals to promote mutual respect for various communities and create a welcoming campus environment. Thus, we strongly support students in their efforts to conduct and participate in diverse social and cultural activities to stay connected to their traditions and at the same time introduce others to their ethics and values in a rich sociocultural milieu.

title: Hostel Life-new - VIT Bhopal
content: VIT Bhopal University offers on the campus housing facility for undergraduate, postgraduate and research students. The university authorities ensure hostel life with safety, well maintained and supportive stay that would meet every individual s comfort and development. We at VIT Bhopal University believe that being a resident scholar is all about an experience rather than staying within four walls with a bed. At VIT, the hostels are surrounded by lush greenery, in the lap of Mother Nature. The University provides separate hostel facility for boys and girls. The hostels have well furnished rooms with different occupancies. Round-the-clock Wi-Fi facility is available in hostels to help the students access Moodle and other online study materials, connect with their family and friends. Students are encouraged to take part in daily sports for maintaining a healthy body. Indoor recreation centre, sports and gym facilities are provided in the hostel premises. The kitchen that meets global hygiene standards serves a variety of Indian and global cuisines. Safety is of utmost priority for us with our hawk-eyed security officers manning the campus, without blinking even for a second. The doctors are available at all times to meet emergency and regular medical needs. VIT Bhopal University is a multi-cultural, multi-lingual campus with students from 30 states and Union Territories, seeking knowledge in engineering and research. An 8 storey Boys Hostel Building with a built-up area of 44,752 sq.m contains Wi-Fi enabled AC and NON-AC sharing rooms with indoor badminton court Read more The cuisines in the hostel range from South Indian, North Indian and Jain menu. The students can choose their food type based on their priority Read More The hostels have fully equipped gym facilities including trainer facility. The hostels also provide indoor and outdoor game spaces for students physical health. An inbuilt Read More Spacious study area in every hostel block is provided to facilitate the studies in concentrated environments for exam preparation Read More Doctors, medical personnel and ambulance facilities are deployed in the hostels to meet any medical emergency, 24X7 Read More 24X7 security service in every hostel is ensured, with lady securities deployed in Ladies hostels considering the privacy of students Read More Culturally diverse events are periodically organised within the hostels to help the residents unwind, network, exhibit their talents and volunteer with the communities, they live and study. To name Read More In house ATM facilities are available for students in hostels and Indian Bank Branch is located inside the academic block Read More

title: VIT Bhopal Information office â€“ Indore - VIT Bhopal
content: VIT Bhopal University, a premier technical institution of central India, that empowers its students with excellence through learning, continues the legacy of Vellore Institute of Technology (VIT). It offers Future Ready Courses with an insight of preparing a highly motivated and skilled generation of technocrats and provides student- centric learning environment, technology-enabled peer learning through interactive strategies of CALTech (Collaborative and Active Learning through Technology). VIT Bhopal University is an International leader in offering research-enriched education complemented by applied, work-integrated, project-based learning environment. Right from its inception (2017), University is nurturing students with personality not only in academic but extracurricular activities also. 100% doctoral faculties having divergent expertise viz. ACM Speaker, NASCOM certified Trainer, Ethical Hacker, distinguished Scientists and Researchers in their respective areas ensures overall development of the students. VIT Bhopal University invites applications for admission in its Future Ready Programmes which will surely help to shape their aspirations and future. During the current pandemic situation, to simplify the admission process for various Future Ready Programmes , The admission team of VIT Bhopal is available at Please enter your name Please enter your contact number Please select your preferred counselling date. Please select your preferred time Please enter your email address Please select counselling reason.

title: Student Ambassador Program@VIT Bhopal - VIT Bhopal
content: VIT Bhopal University provides diverse cultural ambience. The student demographics convey that the University has students from every part of the country. In order to help incoming freshmen adapt to the new environment, the University runs a Student Ambassador Program, which is constituted by student representatives from each state. The incoming freshmen are initially apprehensive about the new environment; they are out of the comfort zones of their homes with parents being far away. The student ambassadors provide support and encouragement to help them feel comfortable in the University. The freshmen also connect to the student ambassadors instantly being from the same state and feel comfortable interacting with them in their own language. The parents can also communicate with the student ambassadors to know more about the University, in terms of academics, campus life etc. VIT Bhopal University displays multi-ethnicity in the true spirit by celebrating regional festivals and conducting cultural events to showcase the rich regional culture of states, through various student regional clubs. Celebration of Onam, Garba, Durga Pooja, Pongal, Ganesh Chaturthi, Christmas are some of the happening events in the University displaying fervour of togetherness as one big family. As a part of the Student Ambassador Program, the University facilitates students and parents to know more about academics, campus life and other activities of VIT Bhopal, by conducting customized one to one online sessions. These sessions can be taken on calls in your own language with our student ambassadors. To fix an appointment please fill the following information:

title: CALTECH VIT - VIT Bhopal
content: Understanding the importance of CALTech collaboration and team work in the business world , we train students in the ways offices, businesses, and even large corporations succeed on the projects developed and produced by team. CALTech Collaborative and Active Learning through Technology is a unique, first-of-its-kind academic and research initiative, exclusively crafted by VIT Bhopal University. It aims at providing a holistic, interactive environment for an intensely gratifying learning experience, for the students. The classrooms have No Blackboard & No Back Benches . Learning here is through Collaborative & Active Learning through Technology (CALTech) , where the laboratories and classrooms have been integrated as studios offering technology enabled learning. While learning in this manner students tend to perform at a much higher level, exhibiting skills which could not be accomplished in a conservative passive teaching methodology.

title: Placement Overview - VIT Bhopal
content: VIT Bhopal ensures the best placements for its students. The university has a centralized placement system for all the campuses through the VIT Career Development Centre similar to the centralized admission procedure followed for all VIT campuses. The VIT Career Development Centre has played a major role in VIT s illustrious placement record in national and international companies. The Placement training is provided to students right from the first semester to help them in sharpening their coding and aptitude skills. The VIT Alumni Association (VITAA) also supports the placement by providing inputs on the current trends in industry that helps in developing required expertise for better employability. VIT Bhopal has a dedicated Placement and Training (PAT) cell which coordinates with centralized VIT Career Development Centre and gives training to students for enhancement of their skills and aptitude. It helps the students to prepare for placement interviews in technical and HR aspects by arranging meetings with professional trainers and VIT alumni. It also ensures that the students are well-prepared in group discussions. VIT is a proud holder for the Limca book of records for the highest number of recruitments through placements done from a single institution by IT sector companies for 7 years. Cognizant, TATA Consultancy Services, Accenture, Wipro, and Infosys are a few names in the IT sector that have their placement bases in VIT. These companies have had about 8,000 placements in the year 2016 and the number seems to increase every year. The placement and training process starts from the freshman year. The training process is personalised for each student. Placement training includes company-specific soft skill training, resume building, vendor-based aptitude, reasoning and coding training, career guidance webinars and mock interviews. The PAT cell works along with the CDC team to refine students fundamental subject knowledge and guarantee quality projects. VIT Bhopal has a strong alumni VITAA (VIT Alumni Association) network that provides all-round support to students. The PAT Cell team provides 24 7 support to the students by arranging peer mentoring sessions and mock interviews during the placement session. Student counselling sessions are arranged to assess their mental condition and ensure that no student is left behind. Students of VIT Bhopal got offers from Apple, Intel, Microsoft, Golman Sachs, AMD, Kivi, Blackrock, NXP Semiconductor, Moveworks, Stryker, SAP, Bosch, Nokia, Ford, Zomato, Couchbase, Baker Hughes, Commvault, CISCO,CITI,UBS, Fareportal, Wells Fargo, Shell, IBM, Mercedes Benz. 2025 Passouts 51 LPA Highest Pakage 400+ Students placed in Dream/Super Dreams Offers 1100+ Overall students placed 2024 Passouts 52 LPA Highest Pakage 700+ Students placed in Dream/Super Dreams Offers 50+ LPA 4 Students 1100+ Overall students placed 2023 Passouts 59 LPA Highest Pakage 1 in 3 B. title: Super Dream Offers - VIT Bhopal
content: In this placement offer, the students are presented with offers with Cost of Company (CTC) of 10 Lakhs and above per annum. In 2023, 4461 super dream placements offer received through CDC, VIT with 624 marquee offer (more than 20 LPA). Motorq has offered the highest CTC of 1 crore per annum and 45 students have got their placement in Microsoft with the Super Dream Offers. In VIT Bhopal 1 in 3 students received super dream offer (Internship/FTE) in 2023 batch and 390+ students in 2024 Batch.

title: Dream Offers - VIT Bhopal
content: In the Dream placement offer, 3369 students are presented with offers with a cost of company (CTC) of 5.5 lakhs and above per annum through CDC in the 2023 batch. In VIT Bhopal, 310+ students received dream (INT/FTE) offers. VIT is a proud holder of the Limca book of records for the highest number of recruitments through placements done by a single institution by IT sector companies for 7 years. Cognizant, TATA Consultancy Services, Accenture, Wipro, and Infosys are a few names in the IT sector that have their placement bases in VIT. These companies had about 8,000 placements in 2016, and the number seems to increase every year. Also, the placement center at VIT is responsible for internships for students. Apart from placements for students in their final year, the Placement Center provides international internships with leading MNCs across the globe. An average of 10 students every year get an opportunity to get internships in the USA, UK, Ireland, Japan, China, Israel, Taiwan, UAE, Kenya, Germany, Nigeria, and Italy. These internship programs help the students earn a stipend, in addition to hands-on experience and practical application of everything they have learned. The placement season is now growing higher as our students are getting placed with Dream companies. We are seeing an upright trend year on year. Some of the Dream offers are mentioned below:

title: Internship - VIT Bhopal
content: VIT Bhopal has numerous internship programs where students can learn about professional fields and get first-hand experience of the work environment even before they reach the actual placements. We work very closely with the industry counterparts and also have a network established with corporates and other universities across the globe that enable our students to gain the experience required for their respective job area while being interns. To boost the placement opportunities VIT Bhopal has an Internship Course of 2 Credits in its curriculum. Internship courses provide an opportunity to our students to explore and refine their potential career path. The experience that students gain from this long internship period narrows the gap with the industry, builds valuable industry connections, broadens their perspectives of the job front, and helps in acquiring skills and knowledge required to face the professional world. This internship makes them strong contenders ready for their job role. VIT Bhopal offers internships for its students. The Placement and Training Cell has close ties with various companies. All the major companies visit VIT and the students apply for and get internships in the third year itself. Like the previous years, In 2024 we had some notable internships from the third year students who worked on various domains. The students have the opportunity to get exposed to the major companies and get placed. Companies like Google, Microsoft, Adobe, Intuit, JP Morgan, IBM, HPE. Vellore Institute of Technology promises all its students placements in established MNCs and Start-ups. The Placement Cell of VIT, or PAT Office, offers students a variety of opportunities in placement of jobs to choose from, after their course comes to an end. Companies, like Intel, eBay, Amazon, Dell, GE, Texas Instruments, Schneider Electric, DE Shaw & Co, Hitachi, HP, PayPal, Tata Motors, L&T, Dr. Reddy s, Bosch, Deloitte, Morgan Stanley, Qualcomm, Ashok Leyland, Honda, Ford, Global Analytics, TCS, Cognizant, Accenture, Wipro, Infosys among others, actively take part in the placement and hiring processes with VIT. The Placement in Vellore Institute of Technology starts from January and ends a year later when students have smiling faces and are secured a placement in leading MNCs with Cost to Company of more than 3 lakhs. The students would refer to the placement processes as a Mega Event and are excited to participate in it. The Placement cell makes sure that all the students are well-versed in Coding and aptitude skills, for better performance in the placement interviews. The Placement (PAT) center help the students to prepare for placement interviews in technical and HR aspects by arranging meetings with professional trainers and VIT alumni. The Placement center also ensures that the students are well-prepared in group discussions. By July, the hiring companies arrive on the campus with offers to fulfill the dreams of the students by providing various placement opportunities. There is a wide range of job placements offered in campus recruitment from various companies. A lot of students are obtaining a placement in the Super Dream Offer while many are placed in Dream Offer. Placement centre has been instrumental in providing international internships and placement offers since 2015. They have placed at an average of 10 students every year in leading MNC s at USA, UK, Ireland, Japan, China, Israel, Taiwan, UAE, Kenya, Germany, Nigeria and Italy.

title: NAD/ABC - VIT Bhopal
content: The vision of National Academic Depository (NAD) is born out of an initiative to provide an online store house of all academic awards. National Academic Depository (NAD) is a 24X7 online store house of all academic awards, viz.certificates, diplomas, degrees, mark-sheets etc. duly digitised and lodged by academic institutions / boards / eligibility assessment bodies. NAD not only ensures easy access to and retrieval of an academic award but also validates and guarantees its authenticity and safe storage. Academic Bank of Credits has been established on the lines of the National Academic Depository (NAD), in the sense, NAD is the backbone of ABC, where the students academic data are held and academic awards are stored (i.e. storehouse of academic awards). Despite the fact that ABC enables students to register or commence credit transfer, the final outcomes of credit redemption and issuance of certificates, as well as the compilation of award records, are administered by academic institutions via the NAD Platform. The ABC platform will provide students with the opportunity to register for a unique ABC ID, an interactive dashboard to see their credit accumulation, and options to begin a choice-based credit transfer mechanism.

title: Aerospace Engineering - VIT Bhopal
content: Aerospace Engineering is a highly specialized technical field that requires overall excellence in mathematical, calculative and observational skills and also exposes students to advanced applications of this field. Aerospace engineering involves aircraft design, spacecraft, satellites, and missiles. In addition, it also involves testing, designing the components and subassemblies for these crafts; including engines, airframes, wings, landing gear, control systems, and instruments. The foundation level courses are Engineering Mechanics, Solid Mechanics, Fluid Mechanics, Thermodynamics, Heat Transfer and Materials Science. These lead to a set of applied courses in Aerodynamics, Gas Dynamics, Propulsion, Flight Mechanics, Theory of Machines, Aerospace Structures, Manufacturing Processes, Automatic Control etc. Understanding the programme a little better Aerospace Engineering is being offered at VIT Bhopal University since 2019. Though it is in the developing stage, the branch is equipped with all basic laboratories and central workshop and flight integration hub, aerodynamics lab and aerospace structures lab will be fully established soon. Our specialised faculty members of the school are actively involved in research and development work. Some of the important laboratories for B. Tech Aerospace Engineering at VIT Bhopal are Strength of Materials Laboratory, Materials Engineering and Technology Laboratory, Thermal Engineering Systems Laboratory, CFD Laboratory, CAD/CAM Laboratory, Machining Processes and Metrology Laboratory, Manufacturing Processes Laboratory and Central Workshop. Curriculum Highlights: Aircraft component design and operations, Real time experiences in aerospace simulation, Design aspects of high end aircraft and space craft, Analytical problem solving techniques for aerospace, aviation sector, Assembling and testing of aircraft and spacecraft 4 years Aerospace engineers design flying equipments to meet particular specifications and quality standards. They develop expertise in control systems, materials, thermodynamics, or flight mechanics. Aircraft engineers design and test aircrafts and aerospace-related equipment. They make sure that aircrafts are well maintained and that all safety procedures are followed. Aerospace engineers may perform or write the specifications for destructive & non-destructive testing for strength, reliability, and durability . Aeronautical engineers use their technical knowledge to improve flight safety and fuel efficiency, reduce costs and address the environmental impact of air travel. The Aircraft Structural Engineers build the structure of an aircraft. Aerospace Design Checker s role is to check whether the designs of aircraft, rocket systems, space-shuttles, etc. are properly done according to the specifications. Aero Structure Stress Analysis Engineers perform structural analysis of Aero structural components and assemblies to interpret results, applying physics. Aerospace Engineering Analysts are involved in modeling and simulation, guidance, navigation, control (GNC), aerodynamic and aerothermodynamic analysis and structural dynamics . Aerospace areas such as structures, aerodynamics, propulsion and control require interdisciplinary knowledge. The field provides an excellent opportunity in computational and experimental research. An aerospace engineer learns the basics of mechanical engineering, civil engineering, electrical and electronics engineering. He has the choice of specialization in numerous areas. The airplanes and helicopters are being explored, while nowadays UAVs are being researched where flapping wing model is an attractive choice. The space exploration has been relentless. Aerospace provides new areas like fluid-structure interaction. Overall, an aerospace engineer has well learned knowledge of aerospace applications which makes him an extraordinary professional. He can apply his knowledge in structures, aerodynamics, propulsion and control systems. They can come up with their own coding, explore the untouched mathematics, experiment in new areas like flapping wing. Finally, it gives a balanced combination of basics with advanced applications. The aerospace area in India requires a thrust where we can compete in research and development of aircraft and spacecraft. VIT Bhopal is one of the best engineering Institutes in central India, offering this B.Tech course. The curriculum at VIT Bhopal includes structure, aerodynamics, propulsion, and control of an aircraft. Balancing everything with knowledge of advanced mathematics and computational languages. The institute also provides multi-physics simulation software like ANSYS and COMSOL. VIT Bhopal offers a balanced course structure, with the Introductory course taught in the second semester itself. The experimental studies will make the students learn and develop. The Institute has a vision where the extensive studies will be done in the areas of fixed-wing, rotating beam, flapping-wing and spacecraft. The emerging areas such as fluid-structure interaction and aeroelasticity will have strong research candidates from VIT Bhopal. Aerospace Engineering has a wide range of research laboratories around the world. ISRO, HAL and NAL are leading organizations in India. Airbus, Boeing, Rolls-Royce and Bell Helicopter provide numerous opportunities in areas such as structures, aerodynamics, propulsion, Helicopters, fluid-structure interaction and aeroelasticity. Simulation software like ANSYS and COMSOL provide the platform for extensive computation. Many IITs provide a good platform for higher education in research. Aerospace structures, aerodynamics, propulsion, control, material science, design optimization, heat transfer, vibrations are some of the basic courses of aerospace engineering. Along with this design of aircraft and spacecraft, mathematics for aerospace Engineers, a computational course (coding and use of multiphysics software COMSOL) will be given emphasis. Focus will be in providing computational and research facilities. Students can either choose for higher studies or pursue a career in industry after graduation. A recently graduated student can opt for Aerospace Engineer, Aircraft Design Engineer, Aircraft Maintenance Engineer, etc. For more information, please follow Career Prospects. As a first year Aerospace Engineering student, it was a wonderful and exciting experience to participate in the workshop on drone making and got trained to fabricate it. This gave me enough confidence for my journey ahead in Aerospace Engineering. Pratyush Dubey 19BAS10037 B.Tech-Aerospace Engineering, 2019-2023 Looking at the stars and rockets flying, I always wondered what would be the science behind it? Will I be able to reveal them? But now, coming to VIT Bhopal I can not only unfold the mystery but also learn to realize it in practical life. Purvika Mittal 19BAS10005 B.Tech-Aerospace Engineering, 2019-2023

title: Aerospace | Study Materials - VIT Bhopal
content: NPTEL National Programme on Technology Enhanced Learning (NPTEL) is a project of MHRD initiated by seven Indian Institutes of Technology along with the Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore in 2003, to provide quality education to anyone interested in learning from the IITs. Course 1 Course 2 Course 3 Introduction to flight by John D Anderson The basics of a fixed wing airplane are well explained in this book. The history, configuration, atmosphere, orientation, design of aerospace elements, physics of airplane, control and propulsion are discussed. The book is one of the first steps while building for aerospace knowledge. Read More Aircraft Structures by David J. Peery This book provides basics of structures for aerospace elements which include elasticity, vehicle material properties and basics of finite element method as well. The stress and strain developed within the airplane configuration, such as the fixed wing, are explained in detail. The author provides solutions which require application of advanced mathematics. Click Here Fundamentals of Aerodynamics by John D Anderson The basics of aerodynamics for an airplane are discussed in this book. Incompressible and compressible flows over the airplane are discussed in detail. Also, the resulting partial differential equation are derived and solved. Read More Aircraft Propulsion and Gas Turbine Engines by Ahmed F. El-Sayed The basic propulsion theories of an aircraft and spacecraft are discussed in this book. Number of engines which have been used in an aircraft and space craft are explained. The focus is also kept on design parameters and solutions of resulting governing differential equations are provided. Read More Flight stability and Automatic control by Robert C. Nelson This book provides basics of stability and control system of an aircraft. The stability and control are explained with mathematical model and theories. Design vision is also kept in perspective. Read More Aeroelasticity by R. L. Bisplinghoff Aeroelasticity requires basics of solid mechanics, structures and aerodynamics at the same time. Book provides advanced mathematical solutions for aeroelastic problems. Few problems, which needs to be solved numerically provide an area of research both in computational and experimental fields. Read More
