title: Bio Engineering - VIT Bhopal
content: Bioengineering is an amalgamation of biotechnology and biomedical engineering. Its uniqueness is its highly interdisciplinary nature, where it encompasses knowledge from a wide spectrum ranging from natural science domains to electronics, material science to computer science and even mechanical engineering to simulation of systems. It blends diverse knowledge of science, engineering and technology to solve real world problems of environment and health. Biotechnology sectors covers diverse fields such as genetic engineering, drug development, food technology, stem cell and regenerative medicine, tissue culture, nanobiotechnology, genomics, protein engineering, synthetic biology and systems biology; whereas Biomedical engineering encompasses domains like neural engineering, rehabilitation engineering, biomimetics, biosensors, biomechanics and implant design, tissue engineering and development of artificial tissues and organs, bioinstrumentation and biosignals as well as image processing. By choosing bioengineering one can get the essence of all these diversified and multidisciplinary domains. The School of Bioengineering is a newly developed school with a focus on integrated approach to solve problems on biomedical and biotechnology. The curriculum offers flexibility for the students so that they can choose subjects based on his/her inclination within the vast field. The department offers a set of core and elective courses that helps students gain knowledge about the real world problems through holistic learning. The sustained effort is to produce graduates with potential to solve real world problems aided by the techniques of biotechnology and biomedical engineering. With an aim to carve a distinguished place for itself in the world of bioengineering, the school strives to: The program aims at educating the students on all facets that make up this growing industry, through workshops/ seminars, market research, industry visits & contemporary expert lectures. The students are encouraged to undertake assignments/ project work from the industry and work towards finding possible solutions to integrate their practical knowledge with industrial practices. Keeping in view the employment potential, in-depth knowledge is provided to the students. Understanding the programme a little better The School of Biosciences Engineering and Technology is a newly developed school with a focus on integrated approach to solve problems on biomedical and biotechnology. The curriculum offers flexibility for the students so that they can choose subjects based on their inclination within the vast field. The department offers a set of core and elective courses that helps students gain knowledge about the real world problems through holistic learning. The sustained effort is to produce graduates with a potential to solve real world problems aided by the techniques of biotechnology and biomedical engineering. The programme aims at providing real time exposure to students through regular workshops/ seminars, market research, industry/ hospital visits & contemporary expert lectures. The students are encouraged to undertake assignments/ project work from the industry and work towards finding possible solutions to integrate their practical knowledge with industrial practices. Keeping in view the employment potential, in-depth knowledge is provided to the students. Curriculum Highlights: Human Physiology, Computational Biology and Analytics, Signals and Systems, Biosignals and image processing, Molecular Biology and Genetic Engineering, Bio-fluid Mechanics, Biomechanics, Biosystems and Control, Introduction to Bioengineering, Physiology of Cells and Tissues, Cell and Tissue Culture Techniques, Bio-inspired Designs, Electric Circuits and Systems, Analog Circuit, Programming Course, Biomaterials, Tissue Engineering, Immune engineering, Stem Cells and Regenerative Medicine, Biomedical Instrumentation, Biosensors and MEMS, Biosafety Bioethics and IPR 4 years Laboratories are well equipped with the state of the art equipment facilities to train the students in conducting experiments in, Bioengineering research provides solutions to the real world problems of environment and health, which are: A genetically modified common house plant can clear air borne toxins inside the house. 3-D printing cells can produce human tissues and organs. The Robotic Prosthetic Arm can sense, touch, move with human thoughts. Inspired from a tortoise, a tiny robotic capsule is developed which can replace insulin injections. Biomechtronic scientists have developed devices that enhance human motor skills which are impaired due to diseases/birth defects. Research & Development is a backbone of innovations. A Bio-engineer scientist strives to develop state-of-art technologies and work on to bring the innovation to make life easier for the medical professionals. The profile of Quality Control Bio-engineer is to survey, inspect and scrutinise the medical products to make sure the product meet all the standards. A Bioinstrumentation engineer develops and designs various tools and instruments used to diagnose diseases which helps physicians to develop line of treatment. A Biomedical sales and service engineer understands the basics of various instruments and works with the manufacturing unit in the sales of the product. Clinical engineers know each and every aspect of medical instruments. They help physicians, nurses and medical personnel to implement and handle them. A Biomechanics or rehabilitation engineer works with the orthopedics doctor to simulate patient treatment plan and helps in modelling various implants and prosthetic. Pharmaceutical Engineers works on discovering, formulating, and synthesizing medication, as well as analytical and quality control processes in Pharmaceutical Industries. The Government of India through the Department of Biotechnology (DBT) supports innovative ideas in the fields of biomaterials for various therapeutic/biomedical applications, biomedical devices and implants, biosensors, imaging and processing for improved diagnostics/existing medical equipment, tissue engineering,etc. Bioengineering is a new discipline that applies engineering principles of analysis and ideas to create new and better biological systems as well as biomedical technologies. Bioengineering consists of fundamentals of both biology and engineering, which may include elements of electrical and mechanical engineering, computer science, materials science, chemistry, and biology. This collaboration allows students, as well as faculties to gain knowledge in their areas of interest and contribute their outcomes with the researchers of the allied fields. The School of Bio Engineering has taken initiatives in International collaborations for faculty and student exchange. The faculty are involved in research related to Biological data analytics, Biomaterials, Tissue Engineering, Bio Sensors for diagnosis and health care applications. The laboratories are euipped with state of art equipments to impart practical knowledge. VIT Bhopal is one of the best engineering Institutes in Central India, offering a B.Tech course in Bioengineering. The School of Bio Engineering has taken initiatives in International collaborations for faculty and student exchange. The faculty are involved in research related to Biological data analytics, Biomaterials, Tissue Engineering, Bio Sensors for diagnosis and health care applications. The laboratories are euipped with state of art equipments to impart practical knowledge. This makesVIT Bhopal the preferred choice for a course in Bioengineering. The curriculum of Bio Engineering at VIT Bhopal is designed in response to the growing demand of Bio engineering professionals in India and abroad. Academia, Research labs, Hospitals and Industries.

title: Bio | Faculty - VIT Bhopal
content: Dr. Siddhartha Maiti Assistant Professor, Email: siddhartha.maiti@vitbhopal.ac.in, pc.boe@vitbhopal.ac.in Dr. Siddhartha Maiti completed his MS and PhD in Biomedical engineering & Biotechnology from University of Massachusetts, Dartmouth, USA. Shortly after completing his PhD, he joined Intel Corporation, Oregon, USA as a Process TD Engineer, involved in the development and enhancement of various semiconductor chips. Prior to joining VIT Bhopal he was a Research Associate in Indian Institute of Technology, Bombay. His research interests include development of fluorescent sensors for bio-imaging of metal ions, development of controlled drug delivery system with electro spun nanofibers, development of small molecular inhibitors against disease-associated protein oligomerization and amyloid formation, role of liquid liquid phase separation of proteins in understanding human neurodegenerative diseases such as Alzheimer s, Parkinson s and Prions. title: Computer Science and Engineering - VIT Bhopal
content: "A programming language is for thinking about programs, not for expressing programs you've already thought of. It should be a pencil, not a pen.- Paul Graham "The computer was born to solve the problems that did not exist before."-Bill Gates The Computer Science and Engineering is established in 2017 with an intake of 152 students under the School of Computing Science and Engineering (SCOPE). The current strength of 2018, 2019, 2020 and 2021 batches are 290, 414, 1100, 1600 students. The Computer Science and Engineering major provides professional education in computer science to prepare the student for graduate study or for a career in the computing field. Students learn concepts and skills needed for designing, programming, and applying computer systems while also learning the theoretical and mathematical foundations of computer science. The B.Tech in CSE with emphasis on Digital Transformation Technologies has received instant endorsement by industry leaders. Nasscom is playing a critical role in evangelizing digital opportunity for the IT sector. The CALTech based learning methodology which enables the teacher and the group of students to mould the learning style dependent on the profile of the learners and create an environment to provide constructivism and collaborative learning. The flipped-classroom model and a unique mastery learning platform integrated into the project based learning approach. This will be embedded with Full Stack Programming, Big Data, Machine Learning, Natural Language Processing, Artificial Intelligence and Internet of Things (IOT) curriculum to make it more industry relevant. Industry experts will work as mentors, along with VIT Bhopal University professors in guiding the students as per the specified methodology. Understanding the programme a little better Public and private sector organizations are entering into unmatched era of technological and Industrial revolution, where the blend of cutting-edge technologies like Artificial Intelligence, Cloud Computing, Data Science, Internet of Things etc. are spreading its wings over the world. Looking at the exponential growth of emerging technologies and steadily growing demand for efficient graduates over recent years, the school of Computing Science and Engineering (CSE) @ VIT Bhopal University is offering specialized programs. VIT Bhopal University, a pioneer in innovation in education and research, designed these CSE programs in close collaboration with international universities, IT industries and government sectors. Here at VIT Bhopal University we offer enormous opportunities to practice, learn, grow and succeed. The faculty team @VIT University is agile towards technologies, highly competent and enthusiastic. The school of CSE facilitates scholars in achieving excellence, in their competitive and challenging job roles, through the programs, trainings and internships offered. Curriculum Highlights: Big Data Analytics, Advanced Java Programming, Software Defined Network, Software Project Management, Python Programming, Advanced Java Programming, Operating System, Design Analysis of Algorithm, Computer Networks, Mobile Application Development, Theory of Computation and Compiler Design, Object Oriented Programming with C++, Database Management Systems 4 years Computer Science and Engineering is a ubiquitous domain which provides students with an understanding of several sub-fields. CSE-Core has the following labs under School of Computing Science and Engineering Harvard Business Review recognized the job as the Sexiest Job of 21st Century. Data Scientists deal with challenges of a business and propose the finest answers through application of data engineering, analysis and processing. Also referred as Cloud Systems Administrator are experts responsible for assessing and translating company s scalable computing and storage needs into plan for robust infrastructure design and development that will further guide the finished product. Administers the operations of data science engineers, analysts and persons with similar roles according to their skills and expertise. Machine learning engineers are proficient programmers, who ensures running algorithms and models over scalable data to bring out the valuable insights for stakeholders in the field of business, healthcare, government operations and relevant domains. Volume, Velocity and Variety of data is growing characteristically. Big data engineers build, integrate and manage infrastructure, tools and optimal solutions for acquisition, storage, processing and analysis of Big (vast amount) data. Business analysts are agile and responsible for determining business requirements and delivering IT solutions and recommendations to stakeholders and executives thus bridging the gap between them. These are strong technical leaders with role of analysing the technology needs of company and administer the implementation of proper data and information systems. Responsible for analysing, evaluating, evolving and improving the data resources in organization for efficient storage and retrieval of critical data and information. At VIT Bhopal, we have the Computer Science and Engineering program to cater to the current needs of the organizations for the development of computer applications and efficient utilization of computer resources. In this program, we focus on the fundamental principles of computing, data structures, hardware/software design requirements and integrated software applications. If you are drawn towards exploring these avenues, CSE core will serve as a suitable choice for you. Virtually every organization in the world, however large or small, requires Computer science professionals for technology assistance in today s age. You can start as a Software Developer, Database Administrator, Web Developer, and Computer Network Architect or if you are more inclined towards the business aspect, you have opportunities like Business analysts and Information Security Analysts. If you have an inclination for research, you can explore prospects of becoming a Data Scientist. At VIT Bhopal, we have a dedicated International Relations cell tirelessly working towards creating International collaborations with reputed organizations around the world. Students can apply for internships and study abroad programs. To excel in the CSE core program, an aspiring student should build a strong background in mathematics and science. They need to have strong oral and written communication skills and must be tactically inclined to solve business problems employing the knowledge acquired during the program. Needless to say, self-motivation is always a desirable skill to excel in any field. Apart from the regular coursework, we have several electives that grant you the freedom to further specialize in a desired field. This allows you to explore various avenues without restricting your domain. We have designed our programs in such a way that you will not be at a disadvantage if you do not have a background in programming. Many of our students tell us that they did not have a previous exposure to programming. We have designed our coursework to accommodate people from different backgrounds and in the first year of the program, we try to bring everyone up to speed with the basics of programming. We have well-equipped labs to support you throughout the coursework with any technology-related challenges. However, as a CSE major, it would be beneficial for you to have a laptop so that you have the freedom to work on your daily assignments and projects at any time of the day. We have a Wi-Fi enabled campus that allows you to stay connected 24X7. When I first arrived at VIT Bhopal, I had this angst having come so far from home. This angst, however, faded quickly thanks to the incredible environment provided here, instilling in me a sense of collaboration, and community. The CS faculty is incredibly supportive and helpful. In the classrooms, CALTech empowers us to do better, promoting healthy discussions and always encouraging questions. All of this has given me a lot of space to grow, both: as a person, and, as a professional having gained keen understanding in the courses I ve taken so far, and in terms of helping me recognize when opportunities present themselves, and how I may effectively seize them. Mohammed Mehboob B.Tech CSE Core (2018-2022) In my experience in this University, the faculty members are very student friendly and approachable in nature. They make sure that all the sessions are interactive and interesting to us. They use a lot of case studies, discussions, role-plays and many innovative ways of evaluation. The CALTech concept is applied to its best. The University organizes various industrial visits, guest lectures, conferences, workshops and case conclaves to give a hands-on experience to its students. The University has various facilities to help you evolve as a student and as an individual, from a well-stocked library, to IT Laboratories, gymnasium, management club activities and many extra-curricular and co-curricular activities. Sifat Singh Khalsa B.Tech CSE Core (2018-2022)

title: CSE | Industry Experts And Collaborations - VIT Bhopal
content: SCSE and VIT Bhopal ACM Student Chapter on 13-02-2019 conducted an Expert Lecture on Career options, Interviews, Case Studies . The Expert Lecture was delivered by Mr Meet Kanodia, Advisor, M&A Associate, and ESCP Europe. Approximately 100 students participated in the lecture. Mr Kanodia focused upon the career options available after the completion of the Engineering course. He focused on many areas to work in like Banking and Finance, Operations, Technical analyst, Management Consulting and Advisory, Product Manager, Start-ups, Information Systems Management, Data Analytics and many more. He explained how to crack the interview. He demonstrated different ideas to successfully crack an interview, how to strengthen the bio-data and the importance of case study in day to day life. Students were asked their opinion on the optimal gap between pursuing MBA or M. Tech after completing B.Tech. The answer was explained to the students in very easy, convincing and understandable language. After that the Q&A session started. The students enthusiastically participated in the question and answer session. Dr. P. Gunasekaran, Vice Chancellor, VIT Bhopal University, Dr. S. Raju, Dean, School of Computing Science and Engineering, Dr. Pushpinder Singh Patheja, Member Chair, VIT Bhopal ACM Student Chapter, Dr Shishir K Shandilya, Division Head, Cyber Security, Dr Baseera K, PC MCA, Dr Sandip Mal, Dr Kanchan, Dr Praveen along with faculties and students were present. The newly constituted VIT Bhopal ACM Student Chapter was inaugurated on 18 January 2019 at Auditorium in VIT Bhopal. The inauguration was successfully completed in the presence of second year B.Tech CSE students, first year MCA and members of VIT Bhopal ACM student chapter. The Association for Computing Machinery (ACM), a global scientific and educational organization represents the computing community. For 70 years, ACM has helped computing professionals to be their most creative, connect to peers, and see what s next. Joining ACM means you dare to be the best computing professional you can be. ACM membership offers resources to help students shape their future with lifelong learning programs, publications providing original research and practical content, special interest groups and local chapters to meet peers, delve deeper into technical areas, and leadership opportunities on stimulating projects. On this occasion the Expert Lecture was conducted on Skype by Mr Arun Kumar K, Senior Manager, IBM Cloud Platform Pillar, Leader India. Mr Arun talked about EMERGING TRENDS, TECHNOLOGY and APPLICATIONS . He explained about top 8 trends prevailing in latest technology along with its tools, job prospects, and applications along with the details of the technology. The technologies were: Artificial Intelligence, Augmented Reality and Virtual Reality, Cloud Computing, Angular and React, DevOps, Internet of Things (IoT), Intelligent Apps (I Apps) and Big Data. It was a very informative and knowledgeable lecture. VIT Bhopal signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) with Red Hat Academy on June 07, 2019. The brief ceremony took place at the Auditorium of VIT Bhopal. The creation of a very valuable partnership of VIT Bhopal with the giant Red Hat Academy was forged in the presence of respected Vice President, Mr. Sankar Viswanathan. The chief guest was Mr. Shirish Pandey, APAC Lead Red Hat Academy. Dr. Jayasankar Variyar, Executive Director Academics, gave the welcome speech. He stated about the programming fundamentals and specification about various technologies like Cloud Computing, Red Hat with their benefits. Mr. Shirish Pandey, APAC Lead Red Hat Academy, the chief guest started with a motivational quote and expressed his enthusiasm to collaborate with VIT Bhopal. He then addressed the students informing about the courses of RHA programme, stating the duration and the mode of delivery of the course. He also added the various advantages of RHA like the students will be given opportunity to do Red Hat certifications, have various technology experiences with some industrial experiences as well, to achieve greater heights and get selected in the dream companies with such experiences. He ended by elaborating upon the upcoming opportunities for the students. Mr. Sankar Viswanathan, Vice President blessed the students. His speech gave everyone the motivation to not only just begin the journey with RHA but also shed light on the various technologies and industrial benefits that the students will have in the future. Vote of thanks was given by Dr. P. Gunasekaran, Vice Chancellor, VIT Bhopal University. He addressed about the various benefits of having RHA associated with VIT Bhopal. Students were very excited to learn and clear the Red Hat Certifications. Dr K K Nair, Registrar, Dr. Pushpinder Singh Patheja, Dr G A Preethi were also present on this occasion. The expert lecture on Cloud Services and AWS was organized on August 07, 2019, by Mr Anil Upmanyu, CEO, Prema Software Solutions, Bhopal. Mr Upmanyu gave a deep insight about the cloud services. He explained the application of cloud services and various cloud services available. He created a good understanding of various cloud services. He explained how cloud services can availed using AWS. The online implementation of cloud services was done on AWS for the students. Additionally the storage service was demonstrated in-front of students. Mrs Upmanyu also demonstrated how a resource can be shared on a cloud publicly. Overall it was a very informative lecture for the students. On this occasion Dr Manas K Mishra, Dean , School of Computing Science and Engineering, Dr Pushpinder Singh Patheja, Associate Professor, SCSE (Coordinator Linux club), Dr Manikandan K, Assistant Dean Academics, Dr Prakash Sarkar, Assistant Professor, (Co-coordinator Linux Club), were present.

title: CSE | Students - VIT Bhopal
content: Smart India Hackathon (SIH) 2020 Project development competition was launched by MHRD, India. Smart India Hackathon 2020 is a nationwide initiative that provides students a platform to solve some of the pressing problems faced by us in our day-to-day lives, and thus, inculcate a culture of product innovation and a mindset to solve challenging problems. In SIH 2020, the students would have the opportunity to work on challenges faced within various Ministries, Departments, Industries, PSUs, and NGOs. The participants may be involved to create world-class solutions for some of the top organizations (including industries) in the world, thus helping the Private sector to hire the best minds from across the nation. In this regard, VIT Bhopal University conducted INTERNAL HACKATHON FOR SMART INDIA HACKATHON 2020 on 1st February 2020. In this mega event totally 28 teams were registered and 27 teams participated. It included 21 teams for software edition and 6 teams for Hardware edition. The performance of the teams was evaluated by our jury members Dr. R. Manikandan, Dr. Pon Harsha Vardhanan and Dr Ribu Mathew. Subsequently, our jury members selected 7 teams in software edition and 4 teams in Hardware edition for Smart India Hackathon 2020 participation. Finally, our Honourable Vice Chancellor Dr. P. Gunasekaran felicitated the students on this great occasion and distributed participation certificates to all the participants.

title: CSE | Study Materials - VIT Bhopal
content: What is Data Structures Data Structure can be defined as the group of data elements which provides an efficient way of storing and organising data in the computer so that it can be used efficiently. https://cathyatseneca.gitbooks.io/data-structures-and-algorithms/content/analysis/notations.html Design and analysis of algorithms/b> An algorithm is a set of steps of operations to solve a problem performing calculation, data processing, and automated reasoning tasks. https://www.smashwords.com/books/view/365630 Knapsack Problems The knapsack problem is a problem in combinatorial optimization: Given a set of items, each with a weight and a value, determine the number of each item to include in a collection so that the total weight is less than or equal to a given limit and the total value is as large as possible. http://www.or.deis.unibo.it/knapsack.html

title: Artificial Intelligence - VIT Bhopal
content: The fields of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) are two domains that are playing a significant role in the fast-changing world of advanced technologies. In the last few years, these both areas have emerged to be the driving force that is being applied at every nook and corner of the world, not just to provide automation but also to tackle real life problems. Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) are an eclectic mix of algorithms, that are implied in a wide range of applications, be it engineering, pure sciences, research and development, medical, linguistics amongst various other areas. Experts in both these domains are going to be in persistent demand worldwide, with more and more corporate conglomerates in India and abroad realizing its potential. The latest trends in AI & ML are aiding different business sectors and even professionals in reimagining the viability of varied possibilities in data predictions, analysis and optimization of possible potential scenarios and successfully tackling the given tasks. School of Computing Science & Engineering (SCSE) offers B.Tech and M.Tech (Integrated) in Artificial Intelligence to prospective students. Today, AI is changing and influencing the global perspective like never before. The faculty is determined and dedicated to ensure that potential. The division encourages students to explore and delve deeper into the world of Artificial Intelligence. Understanding the programme a little better Artificial Intelligence also known as Machine Intelligence essentially deals with developing super smart machines, tools, devices that can understand, predict, analyze, draw absolute strategies for finding solutions to the given task. Precisely, these machines are computers that can mimic cognitive or thought process of the human brain, but at many notches ahead to achieve the set targets. Machine Learning is all about high-end algorithms, mathematical models, statistics that help to categorize, store, analyze a large set of multi-dimensional data. This aids in predicting the current and future trends in business sectors using data analytics. Often referred as a Predictive Analysis in the business sectors, Machine Learning lays emphasis on logic, knowledge-based approach to perform the given task. Globally, both these domains are often referred as capstone courses at the undergraduate and post graduate levels drawing upon computer sciences, information technology, mathematics, medicine and linguistics. AI & ML complement each other thus opening new vistas, providing ample challenging work opportunities for those looking forward to scale greater heights in their career. Keeping tab of latest courses that would nurture students in their career and aid them in achieving long term goals, the School of Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning at VIT Bhopal University one of the first and best engineering institutes in India is offering four programs in the following domains. Curriculum Highlights: Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Natural Language Processing, Computer Vision, Speech Recognition, Artificial Neural Network, Expert Systems and Fuzzy Logic, Data Science 4 years Curriculum Highlights: Computer Vision, Augmented reality, Navigation, Automated Decision Making and Control, Robot Navigation, Machine Learning and Data Mining, Model Predictive Control ,Parallel Computing, Network Planning, Operations Research, Modelling and Simulation, Internet-of-Things, Mechatronics and Robotics Modelling, AI& Mobile Robotics, Natural Language processing, Robotics. Read More 4 years Curriculum Highlights: Cybernetics and its Applications, Sensors and Networks, Medical Engineering, Robotics, Neural Networks, Artificial Intelligence, Human Computer Interaction, Electronics for Intelligent Systems, Modern Heuristics, Evolutionary Computation, Multi-Agent Systems, Biological Cybernetics Read More 4 years According to the data released by the World Economic Forum, Machines and Algorithms in the workplace are expected to create 133 million jobs, indicating a spiralling increase of about 58 million jobs over the next couple of years. Graduating in AI and ML opens an extensive range of opportunities for the professionals as Machine Learning Engineers, Data Scientists and AI Architects. Agriculture, Health Care, Transport, Finance and E-Commerce, Robotics, and Retail Industries are few among various other industries that depend solely on AI and ML to build, analyse, predict their business operations. The real time examples of Artificial Intelligence are precise navigation through Google Maps, spam filters in email and restricting frauds on credit cards. The professionals adhering to 4 principles Fairness, Reliability & Safety, Privacy & Security, Inclusiveness; are the most sought after by prestigious MNCs. The average package in the countries like US is pegged at around $85,000 per annum and the mid-level seniors in India would earn upto Rs 50 lakhs per year. Artificial Intelligent and Machine Learning is a ubiquitous domain which provides students with an understanding of several sub-fields. AI & ML has the following labs under School of Computing Science and Engineering VIT Bhopal University is a branch of prestigious VIT Vellore, the No. 1 private institute for innovation. Spread across a sprawling campus of 200 acres, VIT Bhopal is an abode of learning, technology, extensive research and seamless opportunities. Our well-trained, world renowned faculty are a backbone of our institute, sharing knowledge and offering much needed support to the students. VIT Bhopal , situated in Central India is a hub of state-of-the-art labs, research facilities, vast library and world class facilities for the students coming from India and abroad. Join us to experience the true excellence of teaching and research. The course curriculum is designed to enable the students to meet the industry challenges and standards at the global level. During their course work at VIT Bhopal University, students get to master the foundations of AI and ML, its applications in various sectors including Robotics, Cyber Security and Digital Forensics, Game Development, Manufacturing, Mechanical Engineering, Electronic Sector, and Data Analytics. The carefully crafted niche curriculum offers an in-depth understanding of the course as follows Designing and developing machine learning and deep learning systems. Skilled in Computer Programming, Mathematics and Statistics, Data Science and Deep Learning. Data scientists exploit their analytical, statistical, and programming skills (R, Python, SLQ, etc.) to collect, analyze, and interpret custom data sets. Develop data-driven solutions to difficult business challenges. Working with Business Intelligence and Data Warehousing operating environments. Advanced skills in data analysis and data mining. Research scientists are developing and designing, undertaking and analysing information from real world Datasets. A Big Data engineer develops a Big Data infrastructure architecture for organisations, catering to the financial and customer needs. A Big Data engineer can also play the role of a Data Scientist A data analyst helps companies in making better business decisions and operational environments. The world of computer science and engineering is growing leaps and bounds. Being a graduate or a postgraduate in these courses will make you a master in creating and developing intelligent machines and systems. It is undoubtedly one of the highest paid job sectors that is gaining momentum in various areas including engineering, science and research, robotics, automotives, medical, linguistics, et al. Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning are very exciting courses, that would rekindle the imagination of the young engineers. It creates overall awareness, challenges human mind to design, create, execute and maintain them. Since, these courses are breathtakingly interesting, intensely creative each and every topic would be quite engrossing. In fact, if you are one of those hoping to turn sci-fi into a reality, register right away. VIT is one of the best engineering institutes to study computer science and tops among Top 10 B.Tech Institutes in India. It is one of the very few institutes offering B.Tech in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning after 12th. Being niche courses, it requires faculty with in-depth knowledge in these areas and VIT is a hub of talented professors with global standards, who can introduce and explain all about AI and ML to their students. The current students of AI and ML are already seeking global opportunities. Recently, Tanishq Jaiswal(19BAI10187) first year student of B.Tech. CSE from the school of Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning, VIT Bhopal University, participated in HackHarvard Global Hackathon, conducted by Harvard University. He took part in the open round in education category in December 2018 and won it in Jan 23, 2019. His project was one among the 99 projects proceeded to the semifinal round, 33 from each of the three categories. Subsequently, he won the semifinal round and is one of the three global finalists in education category. Now, he is invited to pitch to a panel of judges, ranging from Harvard Engineering professors, to Harvard startup co-founders, to software engineers at companies like Google, Microsoft, and Facebook on October 20 that Harvard University, Cambridge, United States of America. VIT being one of the top 10 B.Tech Colleges in India is always on the forefront in introducing the best coursework and curriculum. The syllabus is crafted by eminent faculty members taking both current and future trends into consideration. By the end of total course work, the young graduates or post graduates will be industry ready, owing to the hands-on training they receive. The graduates in these areas are hired extensively in robotics, visual and voice recognition. In fact, Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning together can execute from very simple tasks like delivering pizzas, packaging to guarding country borders in tough terrains. The algorithms can keep track of logistics across seas and can build house in a jiffy. There are also arguments that machines start challenging human intelligence but it is far from truth. Today, tomorrow and many decades later humans make decisions and AI machines get programmed to execute the same. The ethics in these area insist on doing the right programming for the world to grow into a better place. AI helps us in reducing redundancy and increasing the efficiency of entities. It is that concept which binds machines with human cognitive tasks. Prakash Joshi PTA CRM at Microsoft India Mumbai Area, India. The Department of Artificial Intelligence at VIT Bhopal helped me gain further insight into my ever-increasing curiosity about the application of machine learning in real-life scenarios, and I hope to make this world a better place with knowledge and experience that I have gained. Tanishq Jaiswal B.Tech CSE Specialisation AI & ML (2019-2023) The faculty of the AI department are extremely cooperative and supportive during my competitions and projects for Techfest 2020, which helped us win the 5th rank at National Drone Competition and seventh position in the international micro mouse challenge. Mohit Hiray B.Tech CSE Specialisation AI & ML (2019-2023)

title: AI | Faculty - VIT Bhopal
content: Dr. Venkat Prasad Padhy Associate Professor & Division Head. Email: venkat.prasad@vitbhopal.ac.in Dr. G. Prabu Kanna Program Chair Lead Email: pc.aiml@vitbhopal.ac.in Dr. Pradeep Kumar Mishra Senior Assistant Professor & Programme Chair Email: pc.aiml@vitbhopal.ac.in Dr. Rajit Nair Senior Assistant Professor and Programme Chair Email: pc.aiml@vitbhopal.ac.in Dr. NILAMADHAB MISHRA Associate Professor Email: nilamadhab.mishra@vitbhopal.ac.in Dr. Mishra is an Associate Professor in the School of Computer Science and Engineering, AI-ML Division, at VIT Bhopal University, India. He received his Doctor of Philosophy (Ph.D.) in Computer Science & Information Engineering with a specialization in Data Science & Machine Learning from Chang Gung University, Taiwan. He has more than 20 years of national and international involvement in academic teaching and research at recognized Indian, Taiwanese, and African universities. He has over 50 publications in SCI/SCIE and SCOPUS-indexed journals, ISBN books and chapters, Indian and Australian patents, IEEE conference proceedings, and others. He has served as a reviewer, associate editor, and editorial board member for SCI/SCIE-indexed journals and conferences. Dr. Mishra worked on multiple funded research projects from the MOST, NSC, and CGU Memorial Hospital, Taiwan, during his Ph.D. and has been involved with several professional bodies: CSI Life Member; ORCID Member; IAENG Member; Fellow Member of ISROSET ; Fellow Member of ISRD ; Senior Member of ASR (Hong Kong); Senior Member of IEDRC (Hong Kong); and Member of IEEE Collabratec . Moreover, Dr. Mishra qualified in the Test of English as International Communication; was featured as a Top Author in PubFacts.com 2018; and was recorded in the World Book of Researchers 2018 published in Oxford, United Kingdom. He is currently an Associate Editor for two SCOPUS-indexed journals, and his research interests span the areas of AI, Data Science, Machine Learning, and Cognitive Analytics & Applications. Dr. Lakshmi D Senior Associate Professor Email: lakshmi.d@vitbhopal.ac.in Dr. Komarasamy G Associate Professor Email:komarasamy.g@vitbhopal.ac.in Dr. Komarasamy G is a Doctorate from Anna University, Chennai, M.E in Computer Science and Engineering from Kongu Engineering College and B.E in Computer Science and Engineering from Bannari Amman Institute of Technology. He has an academic experience of 16 years and currently he is working as Senior Associate Professor at School of Computing Science and Engineering, VIT Bhopal University, Bhopal. He has 31 publications, in peer reviewed International / National journals with high impact factor and he has 29 publications in various International and National Conferences held in India. He was received six awards like India Book of Records, ACS Publication Award, InSc Research Excellence Award, InSc Student Projects Programme, Dr. A. P. J. Abdul Kalam Life Time Achievement National Award and Innovative Research Excellent Academician Award. He is passionate about Teaching and guiding students for both UG, PG and PhD programmes. Presently, two PhD scholar completed their research work, and guiding 2 research scholars under Anna University, Chennai and 5 research scholars under JAIN (Deemed-To-Be- University), Bangalore. He has organized 57 events and attended 84 events like seminar, workshop, conference, FDP and Video Conferencing. He was completed a two consultancy projects like Doctor Application and Mobile Application and portal for Handicapped persons. He served as Editorial board member for many journals. He is a professional member in IAENG, ISTE, CSTA, IFERP and IACSIT. He received many research grants from various funding agencies like DRDO, CSIR, ICMR, DST and AICTE for organizing events and developing projects. In the teaching learning process he used CLM RBT methods to make the students understand the concepts better. He also chaired National and International Conference and Symposiums. He contributed his services as a resource person in various workshops, conference and Faculty development Programs. He also served various Academic responsibilities like PG Coordinator, Research Coordinator, SIG (Small Interested Group) In-charge, college level APPs development club In- charge, NBA coordinator, NIRF In-charge, Short Term Course In-charge, Academic Audit committee member, Lab In-charge, College Web Page Update In-charge, Time Table In-charge, Placement Coordinator, ISO Internal Auditor, Class advisor, Infosys Campus Connect programme In-charge and member in BoS and Alumni Executive Committee member, Disciplinary committee and Question Paper Analysis Committee. Manoj Kumar Teaching Assistant Email: manojkumar@vitbhopal.ac.in Mr. Manoj Kumar is working as an assistant professor at VIT Bhopal. He received the M.Tech Degree in Computer Science & Engineering from MDU Rohtak Haryana. He did B.Tech degree in Computer Science and Engineering from U.P.T.U. Lucknow in 2005. He is pursuing Ph.D. in CSE from Amity University Gwalior in the domain Gait analysis . He has 14 years of teaching experience in the different states of India. He has 8 publications in national and international journals/conferences. His research area includes Machine learning, Gait Analysis, and Image processing. He has received the Srijan award of best faculty in 2016 and 2019, organized by MPCST. Dr.Anil Kumar Yadav Assistant Professor Email: anilkumar.yadav@vitbhopal.ac.in Dr. Anil Kumar Yadav is a Doctorate in Computer Science & Engineering from IFTM University, Moradabad and MTech in Information Technology from SATI Vidisha. He has over thirteenth years experience in the field of academics. His core areas of expertise include reinforcement learning, guidance and control of unmanned vehicle, geo spatial artificial intelligence and Internet of Things (IoT). title: AI | Study Materials - VIT Bhopal
content: What is Artificial Intelligence? Artificial Intelligence, sometimes called Machine Intelligence, is intelligence demonstrated by machines, in contrast to the natural intelligence displayed by humans. Introduction to Artificial Intelligence and intelligent agents, history of Artificial Intelligence,Building intelligent agents (search, games, logic, constraint satisfaction problems) and Machine Learning algorithms https://www.edx.org/course/artificial-intelligence-ai Solid understanding of the guiding principles of AI. Apply concepts of machine learning to real life problems and applications. Design and harness the power of Neural Networks and Broad applications of AI in fields of robotics, vision and physical simulation. https://www.edx.org/micromasters/columbiax-artificial-intelligence AI for Everyone Learn what Artificial Intelligence (AI) is by understanding its applications and key concepts including machine learning, deep learning and neural networks. Understand what is AI, its applications and use cases and how it is transforming our lives explain terms like Machine Learning, Deep Learning, and Neural Networks, describe several issues and ethical concerns surrounding AI and Articulate advice from experts about learning and starting a career. https://www.springer.com/gp/book/9783030193522 Natural Language Processing (NLP) Natural language processing (NLP) is one of the most important technologies of the information age. Understanding complex language utterances is also a crucial part of Artificial Intelligence. Apply deep learning models to solve machine translation and conversation problems. Apply deep structured semantic models on information retrieval and natural language applications and Apply deep reinforcement learning models on natural language applications. https://www.edx.org/course/natural-language-processing-nlp-2 MIT OpenCourseware MIT OpenCourseWare (MIT OCW) is an initiative of the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) to publish all of the educational materials from its undergraduate-level and graduate-level courses online, freely and openly available to anyone, anywhere. ocw.mit.edu This course includes interactive demonstrations which are intended to stimulate interest and to help students gain intuition about how artificial intelligence methods work under a variety of circumstances. https://ocw.mit.edu/courses/electrical-engineering-and-computer-science/6-034-artificial-intelligence-fall-2010/ Machine Vision Machine vision (MV) is the technology and method used to provide imaging-based automatic inspection and analysis for such applications as automatic inspection, process control, and robot guidance, usually in industry. It describe the physics of image formation, motion vision, and recovering shapes from shading. Binary image processing and filtering are presented as preprocessing steps. https://ocw.mit.edu/courses/electrical-engineering-and-computer-science/6-801-machine-vision-fall-2004// Underactuated Robotics Underactuation is a technical term used in robotics and control theory to describe mechanical systems that cannot be commanded to follow arbitrary trajectories in configuration space. This condition can occur for a number of reasons, the simplest of which is when the system has a lower number of actuators than degrees of freedom. In this case, the system is said to be trivially underactuated. Algorithms for Walking, Running, Swimming, Flying, and Manipulation. https://ocw.mit.edu/courses/electrical-engineering-and-computer-science/6-832-underactuated-robotics-spring-2009/

title: AI | Software Tools - VIT Bhopal
content: PYTHON Python has a standard library in development, and a few for AI. It has an intuitive syntax, basic control flow, and data structures. It also supports interpretive run-time, without standard compiler languages. This makes Python especially useful for prototyping algorithms for AI. Visit the website -> PANDAS Pandas is a Python package providing fast, flexible, and expressive data structures designed to make working with relational or labelled data both easy and intuitive. It aims to be the fundamental high-level building block for doing practical, real world data analysis in Python. Visit the website -> MATPLOTLIB Matplotlib is a plotting library for the Python programming language and its numerical mathematics extension NumPy. It provides an object-oriented API for embedding plots into applications using general-purpose GUI toolkits like Tkinter, wxPython, Qt, or GTK+. There is also a procedural pylab interface based on a state machine (like OpenGL), designed to closely resemble that of MATLAB, though its use is discouraged.SciPy makes use of Matplotlib. Visit the website -> JUPYTER Project Jupyter is a nonprofit organization created to develop open-source software, open-standards, and services for interactive computing across dozens of programming languages . Spun-off from IPython in 2014 by Fernando P rez, Project Jupyter supports execution environments in several dozen languages. Visit the website -> SCIKIT-LEARN Scikit-learn (formerly scikits.learn and also known as sklearn) is a free software machine learning library for the Python programming language. It features various classification, regression and clustering algorithms including support vector machines, random forests, gradient boosting, k-means and DBSCAN, and is designed to interoperate with the Python numerical and scientific libraries NumPy and SciPy. Visit the website -> NATURAL LANGUAGE TOOLKIT The Natural Language Toolkit, or more commonly NLTK, is a suite of libraries and programs for symbolic and statistical Natural Language Processing for English written in the Python programming language. Visit the website -> TENSORFLOW TensorFlow is a free and open-source software library for dataflow and differentiable programming across a range of tasks. It is a symbolic math library, and is also used for Machine Learning applications such as neural networks Visit the website -> PYTORCH PyTorch is an open source machine learning library based on the Torch library, used for applications such as Computer Vision and Natural Language Processing. It is primarily developed by Facebook s AI Research lab. It is free and open-source software released under the Modified BSD license. Visit the website -> THEANO Initially released in 2007, Theano is an open source Python library that allows you to easily fashion various machine learning models. Since it s one of the oldest libraries, it is regarded as an industry standard that has inspired developments in deep learning. At its core, it enables you to simplify the process of defining, optimizing, and assessing mathematical expressions. Theano is capable of taking your structures and transforming them into very efficient code that integrates with NumPy, efficient native libraries such as BLAS, and native code (C++). Visit the website -> KERAS Keras is an open-source neural-network library written in Python. It is capable of running on top of TensorFlow, Microsoft Cognitive Toolkit, R, Theano, or PlaidML. Designed to enable fast experimentation with deep neural networks, it focuses on being user-friendly, modular, and extensible. Visit the website ->

title: AI and Robotics - VIT Bhopal
content: The School of Mechanical Engineering (SMEC) was established in the year 2017 at VIT Bhopal University and offers, undergraduate and research programmes in Mechanical and Aerospace engineering. The Mechanical Engineering faculty of SMEC specializes in Machine Design, Thermal & Fluid Sciences and Manufacturing Engineering. Some of the important laboratories for B. Tech Mechanical Engineering at VIT Bhopal University are Strength of Materials Laboratory, Materials Engineering and Technology Laboratory, Thermal Engineering Systems Laboratory, CAD/CAM Laboratory, Machining Processes and Metrology Laboratory, Manufacturing Processes Laboratory and Central Workshop. B.Tech Mechanical Engineering (Artificial Intelligence and Robotics) is a full-time undergraduate program of four years, which will help students extend in-depth and breadth the knowledge and skills in AI Robotics. The field of robotics has been experiencing a significant change from manufacturing applications to entertainment, home, rehabilitation, search and rescue, and service applications. The various subjects offered in this course follow a unified approach to professional practice through various core subjects in mechanical engineering, basic and advanced knowledge in Robotics and AI. The extensive enthusiasm of the current industry for improved efficiency and safety has led to a bigger need for skilled professionals in the vast field of Robotics . The program is designed to enhance the technical knowledge of one or more fields of engineering. This course allows students to acquire knowledge on Mechanical Core, basic and advanced technology in robotics, and application towards the current industry and society. It also allows expanding knowledge boundaries into AI for the design, control, and management of robots. Robotics is intrinsically an interdisciplinary course that contains elements of mechanical engineering, electrical, and computer. So, the graduates with RAIL will learn the fundamental concept of kinematics, dynamics, microelectronics, intelligent control system. Further, they can analyze advanced and disruptive technologies, making them capable of developing a new automated system to monitor, manipulate, and control systems. The student graduates with advanced skill sets and values, making them ready for achieving their professional goal in newly equipped automated industries. This degree provides a solid foundation in core mechanical engineering disciplines with additional knowledge and skills in mechatronics, control systems, communication, robotics, and AI. With the initiative of Make in India, there is a good opportunity for AI and Robotics Engineers. It will support the students to make their career in various fields such as Pharmaceuticals, Manufacturing, Aviation, Automobile, Agriculture, etc. Work with software and core Mechanical Industries. Industry 4.0 demands various interdisciplinary engineers. The course provides a unique opportunity to broaden knowledge in another discipline through different subjects, giving an added advantage to students who seek career options in multidisciplinary areas. Understanding the programme a little better The B.Tech programme in AI and Robotics at VIT Bhopal provides an updated course curriculum in the field of Artificial Intelligence and Robotics. The state of the art laboratory facilities at VIT Bhopal and the industry collaborations of the University provide a real world platform to the students to experience and learn the most recent tools and techniques being used in the Robotics industry today. Students can hone their skills in the following AI and Robotics specializations thereafter: Some of the jobs that give the students a niche include: AI AND ROBOTICS: WHAT FUTURE HOLDS? The fourth industrial revolution commonly known as Industry 4.0 has led to the evolution of robotics, advanced automation machines, artificial intelligence, and IoT (Internet of Things). This is the era of smart systems with hardware and software integration. Industry 4.0 demands various inter-disciplinary engineers. It has changed the face of traditional machines used for industrial purposes. Robots are the new machines. Artificial Intelligence is the tool to control robots. With more industrial revolutions to happen with time, the future of industries will mostly involve human and robot interaction alongside artificial intelligence to bridge the gap. With Industry 4.0 in demand, engineering has also gone inter-disciplinary. BTech Mechanical Engineering (Artificial Intelligence and Robotics) at VIT Bhopal University is a specially designed program to educate our students on the current and future industry demands. Dr Shiv Manjaree Gopaliya Program Chair (BTech ME with AI & R) Assistant Professor (SMEC) VIT Bhopal University

title: B. TECH ELECTRONICS & COMMUNICATION ENGINEERING (Artificial Intelligence and Cybernetics) - VIT Bhopal
content: Aims to combine an understanding of modern technologies with an overview of computational and human aspects of intelligence and create intelligent human machine amalgams. AI & Cybernetics is an interdisciplinary program which provides expertise in Robotics, Computer Vision, Artificial Intelligence, Pattern Recognition, Machine Perception, etc. The next industrial revolution will be application of artificial intelligence in various fields of engineering. Cybernetics was introduced in early 40s as the study of human/machine interaction guided by the principle of feedback, control, and communications. Intelligent control, effective perception and decision making are major pillars of this discipline which indicates the relevance of this program in today s world. The students will get exposure to sophisticated computer algorithms and various robotics applications through this project-based curriculum crafted by experts. The program B.Tech ECE (Artificial Intelligence and Cybernetics) is specially designed that aims to give an in-depth knowledge of intelligence as well as intelligent systems may be artificial and/or biological. We try to provide our students especially with persistent, long-term knowledge of cutting-edge topics which also includes up-to-date research findings. We believe that graduates with such knowledge can easily find their jobs in both academia and industry. With the partnerships with industries and research groups around the globe we allow the students to work in ongoing research projects. We believe that excellent research positively influences the quality of education. Students will be prepared for creative application of basic as well as advanced intelligent techniques in all major areas of engineering. Humans are always ahead of machines and that is the main reason we are trying to give human level intelligence to machines. Artificial intelligence otherwise also called machine intelligence impart human ability to make decisions and learning from examples to machines. Though autonomous machines are available from long before, but decision-making power and perception of environment are provided by artificial intelligence. AI has now applications in almost all areas starting from finance to healthcare domains. Robotics is another area which can be considered as a mix of various domains. High end applications require AI to impart intelligence to it whereas some applications may only require some rule-based systems. Modern era has seen that inflection points in society always create opportunities. COVID 19 increases the opportunities of online education. Rise of smartphones with GPS was the turning point which enabled Uber, Lyft, Airbnb, and many other services. Artificial intelligence and machine learning is now capable of transforming many industries. Cybernetics studies the problem of control systems building and the processes in automatons, computers, living organisms as well as social systems. It creates a unified view of animate and inanimate systems in that it encompasses knowledge of various fields. A formal definition is given by A. N. Kolmogorov as Science concerned with the study of systems of any nature which are capable of receiving, storing and processing information so as to use it for control . Information is probably the major concept brought by cybernetics. Studies in cybernetics provide a means for examining the design and function of any system, including social systems such as business management and organizational learning, including for the purpose of making them more efficient and effective. Basic Programming Skills Technical Programming Skills

title: Cyber Security - VIT Bhopal
content: In this age of quick information, Internet is the engine that is ushering global economic growth, connectivity & relentless communication. The issues related to cyber security of any country, should not impede any of these factors. Instead it is important to create such initiatives and be well-equipped to face and take head-on those cyber offences, that could cause espionage, infringement into copyrights, financial thefts, stealing personal data etc, which can threaten security, financial issues and confidentiality of a person, organization or even a nation. It is no exaggeration to say that the battles in the future will probably be fought in cyberspace instead on land or sea, with the targets being critical infrastructure such as dams and power grids and even healthcare. This has already been attempted in the past. Till date, more than 26,000 websites have been defaced and 91 lakh infected systems have been detected in India. The year 2016 saw over 3 million debit cards getting hacked in India. Worse, 80% of all cybercrimes go unreported! This makes it super important that India fortifies its critical infrastructure and evolves a mechanism that can be practically implemented in case of any cyber breach. And this is where the role of cyber warriors comes in. Understanding the programme a little better In next few years, India will require millions of Cyber Security Professionals to keep the people, organizations and even the economy of India, safe and protected against these high-tech crimes. Looking at the severity and need, specialised courses are greatly in demand on Cyber Security and Digital Forensics. VIT Bhopal is one of the pioneer universities which has started specialised programmes to create expert scholars in this arena. The Cyber Security & Digital forensic division at VIT Bhopal is one of the most active team of learners and experts in central India. Having a close association with the Government agencies, IT Industries and foreign universities, the division provides universally accepted, highly valuable graduate and post graduate engineering courses on Cyber Security & Digital Forensic along with doctorate degrees. Curriculum Highlights: Cyber Crime, Warfare and Defense, Cyber Law and Ethical Hacking, Forensic Accounting & Fraud detection, Mobile Device Forensics, IoT Security, Artificial Intelligence in Cyber Forensics 4 years 5 years 2 years A combination of digitalization and comparative digital immaturity is creating a situation in India so vulnerable to a rising, and progressively more diverse barrage of cyber-attacks. According to global expert services firm EY, India accounts for 3% of the systems from corner to corner of the world that has been intruded and is controlled by criminals. Cyber-Crime is a reality and a major part of the world is ill-equipped to tackle it. By its very nature, the proliferating phenomenon is erratic, often undetectable, and has boundless reach in that a hacker at one corner of the world can disrupt into a system at the other end.Countries across globe at this time are facing different challenges concerning cyber-attacks and digital crimes. Even as our individual and professional lives get changed to virtual domains, we become targets for cyber criminals. It is mandatory to be aware about the risks associated and preventive measures. Cyber Security and Digital Forensic is a ubiquitous domain which provides students with an understanding of several sub-fields. Cyber Security and Digital Forensic has the following labs under School of Computing Science and Engineering The IT Governance Analyst is responsible for providing IT governance, and will align IT investments with enterprise business goals, as well as Bureau and Agency guidance. An ethical hacker, also referred to as a white hat hacker, is an information security expert who systematically attempts to penetrate a computer system, network, application An expert witness who testifies or gives digital forensic related opinions at a dispute resolution trial or hearing by virtue of his/her specialized knowledge. A Vulnerability Assessor (a.k.a. Vulnerability Assessment Analyst) scans applications and systems to identify vulnerabilities A penetration tester is a type of network security consultant that tries to break into or find possible exploits in different computer systems and software. You can think of them as a type of ethical hacker. CISO is the senior-level executive within an organization responsible for establishing and maintaining processes to ensure information assets and technologies are adequately protected. The Security Compliance Analyst is responsible for monitoring, managing and closing existing compliance issues while also ensuring that internal systems are compliant with security standards. The Security Transformation Consultant s responsibility is to lead Strategy, Assessment, Transaction or Sourcing Management engagements. As internet penetration is increasing across the globe, the vulnerability in cyber space is also increasing. Although India is heading towards digitalization, digital immaturity is making India prone to a rising and progressively more diverse barrage of Cyber Attacks. Therefore, requirement of Cyber Security professionals is on the rise, offering immense job opportunities in India and abroad. The Cyber Security & Digital Forensics division at VIT Bhopal University is one of the most active team of learners and experts in central India. Having collaborations with Government agencies and IT companies, the division provides universally accepted, extreme quality, high valuable graduate and post-graduate engineering courses on Cyber Security & Digital Forensics. The curriculum offered provides a perfect blend of theory and Industrial expertise required to develop a Cyber Security professional. Students are participating in Hackathons and various others competitive activities. For more information, please follow Cyber Students Achievements The curriculum offered provides a perfect blend of theory and Industrial expertise required to develop a Cyber Security professional. VIT curriculum is crafted by eminent faculty as well as industry experts, who have niche skills in cyber security. The curriculum highlights are Cyber Security Principles, Malware Analysis, Cyber Law and Compliance, Cyber Physical Systems, and IoT Security etc. Students can either choose for higher studies or pursue a career in industry after graduation. A recently graduated student can opt for cyber security specialist, network engineer and block chain engineer job.For more information, please follow Career Prospects. title: Cyber | Study Materials - VIT Bhopal
content: What is Cyber Security? Cybersecurity is the practice of protecting systems, networks, and programs from digital attacks. These cyberattacks are usually aimed at accessing, changing, or destroying sensitive information; extorting money from users; or interrupting normal business processes. www.cisco.com Cisco explains: How Cybersecurity Works? and Types of Threats https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/products/security/what-is-cybersecurity.html Advances in Cyber Security Analytics and Decision Systems This book contains research contributions from leading cyber security scholars from around the world. The authors provide comprehensive coverage of various cyber security topics, while highlighting recent trends. www.springer.com/ Advances in Cyber Security Analytics and Decision Systems by Shishir K. Shandilya https://www.springer.com/gp/book/9783030193522 What is Cyber Security? Cyber security refers to the body of technologies, processes, and practices designed to protect networks, devices, programs, and data from attack, damage, or unauthorized access. Cyber security may also be referred to as information technology security. digitalguardian.com/ What is Cyber Security? Definition, Best Practices & More by Nate Lord https://digitalguardian.com/blog/what-cyber-security SANS Forensics Whitepapers White Papers are an excellent source for information gathering, problem-solving and learning. Below is a list of White Papers written by forensic practitioners seeking GCFA, GCFE, and GREM Gold. SANS attempts to ensure the accuracy of information, but papers are published as is . digital-forensics.sans.org/ SANS Forensics Whitepapers https://digital-forensics.sans.org/community/whitepapers

title: Cyber | Software Tools - VIT Bhopal
content: WIRESHARK Wireshark is the world s foremost and widely-used network protocol analyzer. It lets you see what s happening on your network at a microscopic level and is the de facto (and often de jure) standard across many commercial and non-profit enterprises, government agencies, and educational institutions. Wireshark development thrives thanks to the volunteer contributions of networking experts around the globe and is the continuation of a project started by Gerald Combs in 1998. Visit the website -> METASPLOIT The Metasploit Project is a computer security project that provides information about security vulnerabilities and aids in penetration testing and IDS signature development. It is owned by Boston, Massachusetts-based security company Rapid7. Visit the website -> SNORT Snort is a free open source network intrusion detection system (IDS) and intrusion prevention system (IPS) created in 1998 by Martin Roesch, founder and former CTO of Sourcefire. Snort is now developed by Cisco, which purchased Sourcefire in 2013. Visit the website -> TCPDUMP tcpdump is a data-network packet analyzer computer program that runs under a command line interface. It allows the user to display TCP/IP and other packets being transmitted or received over a network to which the computer is attached. Distributed under the BSD license, tcpdump is free software. Visit the website -> AUTOPSY Autopsy is computer software that makes it simpler to deploy many of the open source programs and plugins used in The Sleuth Kit. The graphical user interface displays the results from the forensic search of the underlying volume making it easier for investigators to flag pertinent sections of data. The tool is largely maintained by Basis Technology Corp. with the assistance of programmers from the community. Visit the website ->

title: Cloud Computing and Automation - VIT Bhopal
content: The primordial of cloud computing is automation of all varieties of cloud services to meet the demand. The change and requirements of services in IT environment and growing consumer demands raises the development of cloud automation in all aspects of its business. In a broader perspective, Cloud Automation refers to the process of leveraging technology tools and resources to reduce manual burden in provisioning and managing cloud computing workloads The perfect lineup of cloud and automation will drive business growth with scalability and flexibility. Cloud Automation is the only way to keep driving innovation engine of your organization by freeing up resources that actually need to spend time on strategic decisions. Cloud automation is complex and requires specialized tools, expertise, and hard work. Understanding the programme a little better The B.Tech programme in Cloud Computing and Automation at VIT Bhopal provides an updated course curriculum in the field of Cloud Computing and Computational Automation. The state of the art laboratory facilities at VIT Bhopal and the industry collaborations of the University provide a real world platform to the students to experience and learn the most recent tools and techniques being used in the Cloud Computing industry today. Students can hone their skills in the following Cloud Computing and Automation specializations thereafter: HTML5, Angular4, Test Automation, Estimation Techniques, Agile Practices, Production Configuration Management, Continuous Integration, Deployment, Delivery, and Monitoring using DevOps tools, Configure cloud infrastructure to set up environments using automation tools, Intelligent process automation, Bot Design, Cognitive intelligence in Automation, Process Re-engineering design, Smart APIs, Autonomic Automation, Automation as a service, Autonomous web service design. 4 years Some of the jobs that give the students a niche include:

title: E Commerce Technology - VIT Bhopal
content: E-Commerce is buying and selling of goods/services using an electronic medium such as internet. With the advent of Internet e-commerce increases rapidly which makes a billionaire worth business for example, Amazon, Flipkart, OLX etc. It also extended to Mobile and Social media. E-Commerce 2025 has started with the paradigm shift from online shopping to voice shopping, visual search(AR/VR), smart payments (IoT, AI), crypto payments, smart customer support(chatbots) etc. Engineering with Commerce is a powerful combination. Most of the Engineering graduates work in areas outside of engineering such as management, banking and consulting and many go on to become CEOs of major corporations. It s a modernized type of combination that focuses on technology and online business practices of a company. It is a study of an information system to conduct online business. After course completion in e-commerce sector, graduates will gain a comprehensive understanding of creating and managing online businesses also learn how to write business plans, buy and sell goods on the internet and work together with business partners and marketing team to ensure maximum profitable input and output. VIT Bhopal s four-year B.Tech CSE Specialization in E-Commerce Technology develop business skills and complement the qualities that make engineers competent business leaders: problem solving skills, planning skills, and their focus on the future and continuous improvement. The programme focus business in the aspect of Data Science, Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning by introducing the courses like Data Driven Decision Modelling, Social Network Analysis, AI & ML for Business, Business Intelligence in the curriculum. Security aspect of business enhanced by introducing the courses like Data Privacy and Security in Business, Cryptocurrency, Biometric and security systems. Insights of E-Commerce can be taught through courses like Introduction to E-Commerce, Digital Marketing, E-Customer Relationship Management, Enterprise Resource Planning, and Supply Chain Management. The buzzwords of Computer Science, Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine learning, IoT, AR/VR and Cryptocurrency are playing a major role in E-Commerce. Few of them are listed below. Ecommerce tools can help to automate and simplify a wide range of tasks pertaining to the business. This can help to utilize time effectively and increase efficiency. From website designing to managing inventory, these tools can help to complete all ecommerce store-related tasks. Nowadays startups are grown and engineering graduates struggled to manage their business without having much more business management skills. This course will give enough insights about business and manage through online. VIT group of Institutions maintain their legacy in each year. VIT Bhopal is a trend setter for all emerging trends by offering 7 different UG programmes within short span of time. The first university having100% doctoral faculty in India. The curriculum offered provides a perfect blend of theory and Industrial expertise required to develop a professional Entrepreneur. VIT curriculum is crafted by eminent faculty as well as industry experts, who have niche skills E-Commerce domain. The curriculum highlights are Data Driven Decision Modelling, Social Network Analysis, AI & ML for Business, Business Intelligence, Data Privacy and Security in Business, Cryptocurrency, Biometric and security systems, E-Commerce, Digital Marketing, E-Customer Relationship Management, Enterprise Resource Planning, Supply Chain Management etc. Plenty of job opportunities in E-Commerce sector such as: E Commerce Specialist salary in India with less than 1 year of experience to 11 years ranges from 5.6 Lakhs to 22.3 Lakhs. Amazon, Flipkart, Google, Alibaba etc.
