title: Mechanical Engineering - VIT Bhopal
content: Mechanical Engineering is one of the core branches in engineering. It applies the principles of physics and materials science for design, analysis, manufacturing and maintenance of mechanical systems. It also includes the usage of heat and mechanical power for the design, production, and operation of various day-to-day life appliances. The field of mechanical engineering requires an understanding of core concepts from mechanics, kinematics, thermodynamics, materials science, and structural analysis. Mechanical engineers use these core principles along with latest tools like computer aided analysis and design to analyse power plants, industrial equipment and machinery, HVAC systems, transportation systems, aircrafts, marine, robotic and more. Understanding the programme a little better The School of Mechanical Engineering (SMEC) was established in the year 2017 at VIT Bhopal University and offers, undergraduate and research programmes in Mechanical and Aerospace engineering. The Mechanical Engineering faculty of SMEC specializes in Machine Design, Thermal & Fluid Sciences and Manufacturing Engineering. Some of the important laboratories for B. Tech Mechanical Engineering at VIT Bhopal University are Strength of Materials Laboratory, Materials Engineering and Technology Laboratory, Thermal Engineering Systems Laboratory, CAD/CAM Laboratory, Machining Processes and Metrology Laboratory, Manufacturing Processes Laboratory and Central Workshop. Curriculum Highlights: Design of mechanical components, Computer aided modelling and problem solving, Design of autonomous vehicles, Digital manufacturing, Additive manufacturing and 3D printing, Thermal system design, Design of interconnected machines, Robotics and Automation, AI Integrated mechanical system design 4 years Nowadays Mechanical Engineering is not just restricted up to traditional machines and automobiles, but it is expanding its horizon globally in the area of Autonomous Ground Vehicles, Robotics, Automation and Intelligent System, Advanced defence systems, Electric vehicles, Energy Efficient Systems, Healthcare, Digital Manufacturing, Alternative fuels, Safety and Security, Interconnected Machines, Green Manufacturing, Mechatronics, Additive Manufacturing etc. In next couple of decade time, Mechanical Engineering will emerge and collaborate with other key areas like infrastructure, transportation and healthcare to develop new products and energy efficient processes which will lead to safer and sustainable world. Artificial Intelligence will play a key role in upcoming product development process. Mechanical engineers are creative inventors who specialize in developing, designing and perfecting mechanical devices. Automotive engineers research, design and develop vehicles and their subsystems. Marine Engineers are responsible for the design and construction of seagoing vessels and structures, focusing primarily on their internal systems Aerospace engineering is the study of the design, development, and production of air and spacecraft. HVAC Engineer work to improve the available technologies in heating, ventilation, air conditioning and / or refrigeration systems. Industrial engineers apply their mathematical and mechanical engineering expertise to solve problems that arise in production or manufacturing of products. Manufacturing engineers turn the design given by the designer into a reality. Maintenance engineer create, evaluate, and improve maintenance strategies and procedures. Mechanical Engineering is a core engineering branch but recently with the development in Robotics, Artificial Intelligence, and Machine Leaning, this core branch has reached new horizons. Students joining B. Tech Mechanical Engineering programme will undertake new product development using these advanced techniques. In future students will mainly study the interdisciplinary courses like Mechatronics, Automation which mainly requires knowledge of coding and control systems. Therefore students joining B. Tech Mechanical Engineering programme shall be eligible to a large spectrum of job profiles. VIT Bhopal has an all doctorate Faculty Team. The faculty have good academic and research background and are the real strength of School of Mechanical Engineering. They make students very comfortable in the subjects and also encourage the students to undergo research. Also our state of the art labs give students chance to perform various academic and research activities in the lab. The course curriculum is updated regularly looking to the industry demands. Furthermore, various updated elective courses help students to select courses of their choice. Interested students may join the post graduate program in India and abroad to pursue M.S or MBA. Nowadays some leading Indian institutions are offering direct entry to undergraduate students for research programs. VIT always offers new and leading courses to all the students. Students of Mechanical Engineering also have opportunity to study new courses as electives viz. Biomaterials, Biomimetic Design, Biomechanics, Machine Learning, Robotics and Automation, Digital Manufacturing, Mechatronics, Modelling and Simulation etc. The study environment makes it easy for me to learn and inculcate the spirit to stand out amongst the other talents at VIT Bhopal University. What amazes me is the plethora of opportunities that the University provides hence compelling every student to explore his own self. With all together a different environment, VIT lets no stone unturned to bring us closer to our ambitions and goals every day. The industrial visits and our curriculum help us understand the needs of the industry in the present scenario and the workshops arranged gives a hand on work experience to us. M.K.Pragya, B.Tech (Mechanical Engg.), 2017-2021 VIT was always on my wish list of institutes in which I wanted to join since the very beginning of my high school days. I choose the Bhopal Campus specifically as it was filled with new opportunities. The CALTech method of learning, state of art laboratories give me the required hands on experience to develop my skill sets. Anurag Gadgil, B.Tech (Mechanical Engg.), 2019-2023

title: Mech | Faculty - VIT Bhopal
content: Dr. S. Balaguru Professor & Dean Cabin Number: AB204 Email: dean.smec@vitbhopal.ac.in, balaguru.s@vitbhopal.ac.in He obtained his BE in Mechanical Engineering from Manonmanium Sundaranar University, M.Tech from IIT Madras and PhD from College of Engineering Guindy under Anna University. He carried out his postdoctoral research work at National University of Singapore. He works as Dean in-charge of School of Mechanical Engineering at VIT Bhopal. He has 28 years of experience in leading Engineering Institutions out of which he worked as Professor HoD for 11 years. In 2019, he was invited to Kocaeli University, Turkey, under the Mevlana Mobility Programme with a grant as an International faculty to handle a technical course. He solely authored a best-selling textbook on Dynamics of Machines under the Cengage Learning. He brought out an edited book on Recent Advances in Mechanical Engineering under Springer publications. In 2008, his proposal fetched a grant of Rs. 8 lakhs under the MODROBS Scheme. He established an International chapter known as Material Advantage Student Chapter at VIT Bhopal as Faculty Advisor. He has guided 3 PhD scholars and 30 M.Tech projects. He published more than 60 papers in reputed journals. He presented 30 papers in the International conferences held in India and abroad. He has 5 patents and several book chapters to his credit. He has been a reviewer for many reputable journals. He visited Singapore, Hong Kong, Malaysia, Indonesia, Thailand, Cambodia and Turkey for academic works. His research fields are cladding, composites and nuclear materials. He is a Fellow as well as CEng. of the Institution of Engineers. He is a member of the American Society of Mechanical Engineers (ASME). He is a life member of Indian Society for Technical Education (ISTE). Dr. Rohit Sharma Cabin Number: A320 Senior Assistant Professor and Programme Chair Email: pc.bme@vitbhopal.ac.in, rohit.sharma@vitbhopal.ac.in Dr. Rohit Sharma is currently serving as Senior Assistant Professor and Programme Chair-Mechanical at VIT Bhopal University, India. He earned his Ph.D. from Politecnico di Milano (POLIMI), Italy in Energy and Nuclear Science & Technology in 2017. His research focused on the near-field region of turbulent swirling jets in the combustion & propulsion laboratory. Notably, Dr. Sharma received an esteemed Erasmus Mundus fellowship sponsored by the European Commission in 2013 to pursue his Ph.D. Prior to his doctorate, Dr. Sharma received his M.Tech in Thermal Engineering from NIT Warangal in 2013 and a B.E. in Mechanical Engineering from LNCT Bhopal in 2010. Over the years, he has amassed extensive experience in the field of research and academia. For three years, he worked as a Senior Project Research Scientist at IIT Bombay. He also served as an Assistant Professor at NIT Jalandhar for some time and gained invaluable industrial experience as a Graduate Engineer Trainee at Vardhman Yarns for one year. Dr. Sharma has an impressive record of 25 publications in esteemed journals and conferences and has been honored with best research paper and poster awards. As a core team member, he actively participated in the student solar ambassador workshop organized under the SoULS project at IIT Bombay, which achieved the Guinness World Record on 2nd October 2018 for lighting the most LED lights based on solar energy. He has contributed to other sponsored projects such as the Energy and Economic Growth (EEG) project in collaboration with the University of California, Berkeley, USA, and Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory, Berkeley, USA. Also, he worked on the TATA Research project in collaboration with Boston College, USA, under the SoULS, IIT Bombay umbrella. He has recently been awarded an International Travel Grant (2022) in the Young Scientist category and a Seminar/Symposia Grant (2023) by SERB, Department of Science and Technology, Government of India, serving as the Principal Investigator. He has traveled to numerous countries, including France, Greece, Italy, Poland, Portugal, Saudi Arabia, Switzerland, and the United Kingdom, to present his research at various international conferences. Dr. Sharma has successfully organised several international conferences and workshops as Organising Secretary and Convener. His diverse research interests encompass Experimental Fluid Dynamics, Optical Diagnostics, Flow Visualization, Internal Combustion Engines, Proper Orthogonal Decomposition, Predictive Modelling, Rural Electrification, and Off-grid Solar Energy. Dr. Pushpdant Jain Cabin Number: AB412 Senior Assistant Professor Email: pushpdant.jain@vitbhopal.ac.in Dr Pushpdant Jain has more than 12+ years of experience including, in industries and academic institutions. Currently, he is working with VIT Bhopal University as a Senior Assistant Professor in the School of Mechanical Engineering. Dr Jain holds PhD in Industrial Design from the National Institute of Technology, Rourkela (Odisha). He has published more than 30+ publications which includes SCI, SCOPUS journal articles, book chapters and conference publications. He has authored 02 books as an Editor. Dr Jain has published more than 16 patents/design registrations and granted with 13 design registrations. He has organized one international conference as an Organizing Secretary and the conference proceeding was published in Springer Lecture Notes in Mechanical Engineering (SCOPUS indexed) in the year 2023. Dr. Jain is also an active reviewer of various reputed journals such as Scientific Reports (Nature Journal), Medical & Biological Engineering & Computing (Springer Nature), BMC Musculoskeletal Disorders (Springer Nature), BioMed Research International (Hindawi Publications), Biomedical Physics & Engineering Express (IOP Publishing), Informatics in Medicine Unlocked (Elsevier) and Journal of the Brazilian Society of Mechanical Sciences and Engineering (Springer Nature) etc. He is an active member of the European Society of Bio-Mechanics (ESB), Society of Automotive Engineers (SAE), a life member of the International Association of Engineers (IAENG), Indian Institution of Industrial Engineering (SMIIIE) and Indian Society for Technical Education. In addition to this, he was awarded with Research Scholar of the Year in the year 2018 at NIT Rourkela for his PhD Work. His research interest includes New Product Development, Spinal Implant, Bio-Mechanics, Finite Element Analysis. Dr. Kumari Ambe Verma Cabin Number: A410(AB404) Assistant Professor Email: kumariambeverma@vitbhopal.ac.in Dr. Kumari Ambe Verma is an accomplished researcher and academic with a Ph.D. in Mechanical Engineering from the National Institute of Technology (NIT) Silchar, Assam, India, and an M.Tech in Mechanical Engineering from Lovely Professional University (LPU), Punjab, India. Her doctoral research focused on enhancing combustion efficiency in scramjet engines through numerical simulations using ANSYS Fluent. She has significant international research exposure, having worked as a Senior Researcher at GNU Jinju, South Korea, where she specialized in thermal management of electric motors using COMSOL Multiphysics. Proficient in advanced modeling tools like ANSYS Fluent, OpenFOAM, and COMSOL, Dr. Verma combines technical expertise with sustainable design principles and materials innovation. Her work reflects a commitment to advancing thermal sciences and fostering engineering solutions with a focus on sustainability and cutting-edge technologies.

title: Integrated M. Tech Computer Science and Engineering (Computational and Data Science) - VIT Bhopal
content: Computational Science has emerged as one of the niche areas in Computer Science education. This M.Tech course is designed for students who would like to become Computer Science Engineers specializing in Computational and Data Science (CDS). The study of Computational Science (i.e. Computational Systems Science) involves mastering the design, development and analysis of computational systems of high performance, distributed, cloud, parallel, scalable software and hardware. Likewise the study of Data Science involves mastering Big Data Analysis, Image Analysis, Data Visualization, Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence. The fourth industrial revolution, Industry 4.0 includes key technologies like Cloud Computing, high performance computing, Big Data Analytics, Image Analysis. This programme inculcates the above mentioned technologies and skills required for the future jobs in the IT industry. It also provides courses which develop research aspirations. VIT Bhopal has all the bells and whistles to offer this course for the student fraternity through which students can be enlightened in their professional life. The programme equips the student with basic foundations in Computational and Data Sciences. It indoctrinates advanced research based skills as a master of computational and data engineering. In addition to the subjects of a B.Tech Computer Science and Engineering programme, the graduate will also learn the following subjects: Computer vision is an interdisciplinary scientific field that deals with how computers can gain high-level understanding from digital images or videos. Big data analytics is the use of advanced analytic techniques against very large, diverse data sets that include structured, semi-structured and unstructured data, from different sources, and in different sizes from terabytes to zettabytes. High-performance computing (HPC) uses supercomputers and computer clusters to solve advanced computation problems. Today, computer systems approaching the teraflops-region are counted as HPC-computers. A scalable and parallelized machine learning platform on the cloud to process large-scale data like Big Data. Probability, statistics, matrics, linear algebra, statistical models, feature extractions. Learning supervised, unsupervised machine learning algorithms. NASSCOM has collaborated with leading analytics companies such as Accenture, Fractal Analytics, TCS, Cap Gemini and Wipro, to name a few, and created a program that will ensure learners are ready to be absorbed by these leading companies. If you are curious about how Big Data, NoSQL and ML platforms work internally and how to use them efficiently to store and process terabytes of data, this is the course for you. Data visualization is the process of putting data into a chart, graph, or other visual format that helps inform analysis and interpretation. Image analysis can include tasks such as finding shapes, detecting edges, removing noise, counting objects, and calculating statistics for texture analysis or image quality. The programme also requires three dissertation based projects to be completed in the final semesters to enable the graduates to become industry ready. Highest salary: Number of jobs in 2025 Market share of Computational and Data analytics business out of the whole IT industry List of top 10 companies with highest salary It is a combination of applying computational techniques to solve scientific problem and extracting useful information by applying statistics, machine learning techniques on the given data for prediction, decision making, basic analysis. VIT Bhopal has 100% doctoral factory. The University is equipped with well-established laboratory with high end computing machines to carryout high dimensional data. All the phases of Data science namely Data preprocessing, Data Engineering, Data exploration, Feature extraction, Predictive modeling, Data visualization will be well taught through hands on sessions, tools. High computational programming, designing is also taught to tackle the Big data and highly streaming data to cater the recent advancements and requirements. Yes, it is a PG, Master degree program. After the completion of this degree program, it will be equivalent to a regular PG program. As it is Master s program, the curriculum is designed in a way that perusing PhD will be easier. The curriculum has all the advanced, research oriented courses in the curriculum. No, it is not a dual degree. One will get only one degree certificate, which will be M.Tech integrated degree certificate. Data Science is a high profile job compared to Data analyst. A data analyst A data analyst addresses business problems but a data scientist not just addresses business problems but picks up those problems that will have the most business value once solved. HPC helps engineers, data scientists, designers, and other researchers solve large, complex problems in far less time and at less cost than traditional computing. Also known as parallel computing and supercomputing, high-performance computing (HPC) aggregates data processing power to deliver efficient, reliable, and rapid result, which is the future computing technology. Data Science has tremendous applications not just limited to one field. Its applications are distributed across various sectors. Automobile Industry, Healthcare, Army and Weapons, Power and Energy, Banking and Finance, Scientific research etc.

title: M.Tech Artificial Intelligence and Data Science - VIT Bhopal
content: The master degree M.Tech in Artificial Intelligence and Data Science is the pinnacle degree in Artificial Intelligence and Machine learning. It is a two years post graduate program for the under graduates who would like to pursue their career in the relevant field. An under graduate who has completed B.Tech/B.E in CSE or in any other engineering discipline, may take admission here. After completing masters in AI & DS, the graduates may apply the techniques learnt in AI & DS to improve their processes, manufacturing, development and etc, in their own field of domain expertise. Any engineering graduate like mechanical engineer, electronics engineer, bio engineer or any other engineer may apply AI & DS in their engineering field to improve their business. Artificial Intelligence (AI) is playing a major role in the fourth industrial revolution and we are seeing a lot of evolution in various machine learning methodologies. AI techniques are widely used by the practicing engineer to solve a whole range of hitherto intractable problems. One can learn to apply AI methods in all branches of engineering. Some area where AI is applied, E-Commerce, Education, Lifestyle, Human resources, Healthcare, Agriculture, Gaming, Automobiles, Social media, Marketing, Finance and etc. @VIT Bhopal The curriculum is designed in such a way that it incorporates both basic level courses as well as higher level courses in AI & DS. The basic courses like AI&ML, Foundations of Data science, Deep learning, Data analysis & Visualization will help the students to form basic understanding in AI & DS. The courses like modeling & simulation, AI for High performance computing, Optimization methods in machine learning, Image analytics, Autonomous vehicles will help develop research oriented topics. The program will also facilitate students to take up on research oriented projects in the cutting edge technologies of AI & DS. Total credit is 70. Out of which the projects and master thesis will attract 16 credits which is 23% of the total credits. So much importance is given for projects and thesis. The open elective will enable students to acquire basic knowledge in other engineering domains where one can apply AI & DS. The programme includes, Scikit Learn, Tensorflow, Theano, Caffe, MxNet, Keras, PyTorch, CNTK. Tableau, Google Data Studio Open MP, MPI, CUDA programming, C++, Python OpenCV, Python NLTK, SCIKit, Keras Hadoop, PIG, Hive, SparkML, NoSQL, MongoDB, Casandra, HBase, Kafka In software industry, a post graduate will earn better salary compared to an under graduate. The research oriented jobs in research concerns has better prospects than a regular job. Yes. Any graduate from engineering disciplines is eligible for admission. Yes, most of the time. Unless if companies specifically ask for only UG/PG graduates, which is very rare. Obviously in software industries a PG graduate salary is better than a UG graduate salary. No, one has to attend classes in person unless there is any restrictions imposed by governments because of pandemic situations. Usually universities offer either AI or DS degree programs. Very rarely they offer such program. Of course it has. The laboratories are equipped with high end servers, clusters and workstations. They have all the software licenses one would require to carry out research in AI & DS. We have 100% doctoral faculty who do active research who are going to deliver the classes. Research oriented courses in AI & DS. Since it s the combination of AI and DS, it is different from our AI and DS programs. These technologies will exist for another 25 years at least. Yes. Since the future cannot exist without either AI/ML or DS.

title: MCA - VIT Bhopal
content: "The purpose of software engineering is to control complexity, not to create it." "The most important property of a program is whether it accomplishes the intention of its user." - C.A.R. Hoare "When computers are networked, their power multiplies geometrically" - Scott McNealy Master of Computer Application is a lucrative and attractive career option. The MCA course prepares the students for highly productive careers in IT and Software companies. The MCA graduates can fulfil the high demands of IT experts in IT industry. Earning a master s degree in computer science gives the students an opportunity to contribute to the advancement of the modern computer techniques. Master of Computer Application is a professional master s degree program in computer science. The course imparts theoretical as well as practical training to the students about current tools and technologies in IT and meet the thriving requirement of IT professionals. Understanding the programme a little better The duration of the course is two years in VIT Bhopal. As the IT and the software industry are dynamic and fast growing, all the programmes are designed keeping in view the requirements of industry. The program aims at the understanding of the fundamentals of computing among the students so that they can compete in the present-day global scenario. The MCA program is inclined more towards Application Development and thus has more emphasis on latest programming languages and tools to develop better and faster applications. At present IT enthusiastic employees are demanded by organizations across the globe. VIT is striving to fulfill their demand by providing talented and skilled students. Curriculum Highlights: Cloud Computing, Advanced Operating System, Advanced Computer Network, Data Structure, Data Mining, Big Data Analytics, Object Oriented Software Engineering, Advanced Data Base Management, Internet and Web Programming, Mobile Application Development, Software Project Management, Advanced Optimization Techniques 2 years System analyst uses analysis and design techniques to solve business problems using information technology. Systems Designers are responsible for designing the information systems. They are mainly involved in prototyping by providing comprehensive plan and instructions. A troubleshooter assists customers by diagnosing and troubleshooting software and hardware related problems. A Software Application Architect is responsible for creating new applications or improving existing ones. They also develop product prototypes. A Software consultant advises clients on configuration of large applications, writing code, and fixing bugs. A Network Administrator is responsible for day-to-day upkeep of a company s network and computer system. A Technical Writer is responsible for preparation of documents like instruction manuals, journal articles that are vital to understand complex technical processes. Database Administrators are responsible for installation and maintenance of database servers. They also develop processes for optimizing database security. The department of MCA (Masters of computer applications) has organized a study visit at Indira Gandhi Rashtriya Manav Sangrahalaya, Bhopal on 4th May 2024 (Saturday) from 10:AM to 6:30 PM. The visit was organized for the purpose of the Application Project in Community Service . Indira Gandhi Rashtriya Manav Sangrahalaya also referred to as the National Museum of Humankind, or Museum of Man and Culture is a museum located in Bhopal, Madhya Pradesh, India. The museum spreads over an area of about 200 acres on the Shymala Hills in the city. This museum depicts the story of mankind in time and space. It is the largest ethnographic museum in India. Students visited at Vithi Sankul, Library and Museum for the data collection required to build the projects. Under the guidance of the museum curators, this tour group visited the museum s indoor exhibition gallery, building gallery complex, coastal village and desert village open-air exhibition, and tribal open-air exhibition areas. Prof. Amithabh Pandy, the Director, Indira Gandhi Rashtriya Manav Sangrahalaya, addressed the students while discussing their research topic in the conference room. In his address, he explained in detail the role of the communities in maintaining this museum and also inspired the students to work towards making the museum accessible to more and more people through modern information technology. Under the guidance of the museum curators, this tour group visited the museum s indoor exhibition gallery, building gallery complex, coastal village and desert village open-air exhibition, and tribal open-air exhibition areas. Prof. Amithabh discussed on various projects and asks the students about technology contributions from their side. The Director, Indira Gandhi Rashtriya Manav Sangrahalaya thanked the VIT Bhopal, University for arranging the study tour. At the end of the conference talks Dr. Anjali Mathur, Associate Professor, Program Chair-MCA and the Convener of the study tour has delivered the vote of thanks. MCA is a master degree program pursued by undergraduate students after completion of BCA, B. Sc.(IT), or B. Sc.(CS). MCA course contains subjects of core computer science, mathematics and management. This course focuses on the latest techniques and tools of faster and better software application development. The MCA programme prepares students to take up positions as system analysts, systems designers, Programmers, Software developer, Software Engineer, Trouble-shooter, System Analyst, Software Application Architect, Software Consultant, Hardware Engineer, Network Administrator, Technical Writer, System Developer, Website Designer, Developer and Manager in any field related to information technology. MCA is two year masters degree program in VIT Bhopal. Course curriculum of MCA program is designed keeping in view the requirements of IT industries. VIT Bhopal provides a great internship and placement opportunity to MCA students. It provides the technical as well as non-technical (Soft skills, verbal, non-verbal) placement training by the IT professionals. Various 700+ multi-national companies like HCL, INFOSYS, TCS, WIPRO, ACCENTURE, CONTINGENT, AMAZON etc. visit the campus for placement. The campus is well-equipped with 24X7 Wi-Fi facility, library facility, hostel facility in the campus. It has studio based classrooms. The usage of Caltech technology of learning provides a student-friendly environment inside the classroom. MCA qualified students can get job in government as well as private sector in India and aboard. After MCA students can join MCA students can opt for the various specialization fields such as Networking Internetworking Cyber Security Game development Mobile App Development Software Development Management Information System Web Site Development Hardware Technology Database Administrations System Development System Engineering Multimedia Animation MCA is a two-year master s program in VIT Bhopal. Recognized Bachelor s Degree of Minimum 3 Yrs duration in BCA, B.Sc (IT/Computer Science) with Mathematics as a course at 10+2 level or at Graduate Level. Obtained at least 60% or 1st Class at the qualifying Examination. The students have to appear for the VITMEE which is an online entrance examination for MCA. VITMEE is conducted every year in first week of June by the VIT university. VIT Bhopal, A PLACE TO LEARN, A CHANCE TO GROW is not just a slogan but in fact, it is reality. The one thing which enticed me was the environment of VIT Bhopal. The University offers you many opportunities for making yourself self-confident in every section of the curriculum. Comprehensive Placement and Training Programs offered by the Placement cell help us to secure our future and compete in the real world. The workshops provide us an opportunity to learn something new in our respective fields. Apart from academics, VIT ensures that the student is active in their fields of interest, providing various clubs, curriculum activities and events. The University is also well diverse as people come from all over the country which makes us learn about different cultures. Akshay Surange MCA, 2019 2021 VIT Bhopal University is a better place with 100% doctorate faculty. Especially they provide Caltech learning technique which helps students procure not only conceptual knowledge but empirical knowledge too. They provide opportunity to go for national and international competitions with proper direction provided by various faculty members. There are many courses like artificial language, machine learning, cyber security, aerospace, gaming etc. VIT help students to explore talent within, by organising workshops and various technical activities which gives hand full of experience and knowledge. Deepika Sharma MCA, 2019 2021

title: PhD - VIT Bhopal
content: VIT Bhopal University is a premier technical institution of central India, which empowers its students with excellence through learning. Continuing the legacy of Vellore Institute of Technology (VIT) (Institution of Eminence, declared by Govt. of India), VIT Bhopal University offers Future Ready Programs with an insight of preparing a highly motivated and skilled generation of technocrats and provides student- centric learning environment, technology- enabled peer learning through interactive strategies of CALTech (Collaborative and Active Learning through Technology). 100% Doctoral faculties having divergent expertise viz. ACM Speaker, NASSGOM certified Trainer, Ethical Hacker, distinguished Scientists and Researchers in their respective areas ensure overall development of the students. To prepare a globally competent generation of professionals, collaboration with reputed national and international organisations and strategic partnerships with universities around the world are being established. Fundamental and Multi-disciplinary education/research environment at VIT Bhopal inspires analytical thinking, creativity end ethical practices through experiential learning. It encourages the younger generation to act in the general interest of collective-wellbeing and sustainable development. VIT Bhopal University faculty members are largely involved in the specialization areas like Gaming Technology, Cyber Security end Digital Forensics, Robotics, Artificial Intelligence, Natural Language Processing, Drone Technology Geoinformatics, Cloud Forensics, Human Computer Interaction, Biosensors & Healthcare Systems, Bioelectronics and Biomechanics, Next Generation Cybernetics, CFD end High Performance Computing, VTOL/STOL Vehicles, Space Weather, Solar Physics, Material Science, Computational Chemistry, Operational Research, Optimization etc. Subject Areas Subject Areas Subject Areas Subject Areas Subject Areas Subject Areas Subject Areas VITREE Syllabus Download

title: Business School - VIT Bhopal
content: Businesses have a platter of activities that have to be kept in line for the proper functioning of the companies so that it grows in all respects and achieves a name in the market space. In a country like India, where many entrepreneurial ventures dwell but are never able to withstand in the market, one of the major reasons for the downfall of many companies can be a failure in the administration of the business and its activities. The dynamics and success factors are extremely difficult to understand according to the different markets, where the frequency of the changing market demands is very high. Business and management degrees deals with management and handling of all the business activities that include and pertain to customers, the supervision and administration of finance, accounting, and marketing aspects of a business. Management education has emerged as one of the major career options against the mainstream career prospects. Many career guides have stated that management and commerce is the next big career option for all students who have the interest and passion to study how businesses work in the real world and complex market scenarios. Students, who have developed a curiosity for learning business administration and management, have started taking business degrees as a serious career opportunity. To be a School of excellence in Business Education, Research and Consultancy for producing business leaders, matching global standards. Understanding the programme a little better VIT Business School at VIT Bhopal was founded in the year 2017 with an aim to impart teaching and training to the managerial aspirants with focus on value-based business and commerce education. It has become one of the prominent business schools in central India. The school offers 1 UG and 1PG programs which are Bachelor of Business Administration (BBA), and Master of Business Administration (MBA). The courses are designed to infuse strong industry related business principles with deep insights. Moreover, the school not only imparts business education but also creates prospects for the growth and development of the local entrepreneurs, amplifies management research and brings various innovative consulting projects. The school has distinguished resourceful academicians, who have pursued their doctoral programs from reputed institutes and published in the national and international journals of repute. Curriculum Highlights: Business Policy and Strategic Management, Emotional Intelligence, Entrepreneurship Development, Digital Marketing, Supply Chain Management, Micro Economics, Production and Operations Management, Business Law, Basic Banking Process, Marketing Research, Consumer Behaviour, Business Statistics, Written analysis and Communication, Human Resource Management, Financial Management, Principles of Accounting, Marketing Management, Management Accounting, Enterprise Resource Planning, Managing Personal Finance, Securities Analysis and Portfolio Management, International Business 4 years (As per NEP) Curriculum Highlights: Human Resources Management, Manpower Planning, Recruitment and Training, Learning and Development, Organizationl Behaviour, Organizational and Industrial Relations Climate, Labour Laws, Strategic Management, Marketing research, Consumer Behaviour, Marketing strategy, Digital Marketing and /social media management, Entrepreneurship development, Data Analytics, Fintech and Financial Solutions, Corporate Social Responsibility, Business Statistics, Business Laws. 2 years As a finance manager the job can be pretty varied, ranging from standard accounting routines through to involvement in commercial projects, system reviews and implementation, as well as representing finance to senior management Business Administrators handle the operational, organizational, and managerial responsibilities of a company. They are known by many job titles including CEO, general manager, and operations manager. Collaborate with the VP of Marketing to develop and execute both online and offline marketing strategies and tactics designed to generate leads. Manage employees in the marketing department and create team goals and targets Developing and implementing HR strategies and initiatives aligned with the overall business strategy. Bridging management and employee relations by addressing demands, grievances or other issues. Managing the recruitment and selection process Posting and processing journal entries to ensure all business transactions are recorded, updating accounts receivable and issue invoices, updating accounts payable and perform reconciliations A graduate in Commerce or Management have roles in banks like Bank Manager Assistant Manager, Market Analyst, Customer Service Executive, Sales Executive, Investment Banker, Insurance Specialist, Loan Officer, IT Officer, Operations Research Office. Business consultants work in areas that include marketing, human resources, management, and accounting. Information systems managers (IS Manager) implement information technology in an organization, overseeing a team of IT professionals. Students who have passed 12th standard with minimum of 70% marks are eligible to pursue this professional course. If any student is interested in pursuing a management and commerce course right after 12th, then BBA is definitely a choice for them. BBA will help you to acquire professional skills during your career as a management professional. This course will give you an overall understanding on business process and develop business skills such as communication skills, critical thinking, leadership and decision making. Business school provides specializations like Finance, Accounting, Marketing, Human Resource Management and international business. VIT Business school provides world class infrastructure, 100% placement assistance and immense industrial exposure. VIT Business school provides a wonderful platform to the students to grow through rigorous training and mentoring from high qualified faculties and corporate professionals. Further, industrial trip and summer internship are facilitated to the students to make them industry ready. It has been a great experience to be a part of VIT Bhopal University. VIT Business School gave me opportunity to attend workshops such as SPSS (Statistical Package for the Social Sciences), and in leadership, Stock market & investments and many more. Prachi Soni BBA, 2017-2020 VIT Bhopal University has been helpful in developing an aspiring entrepreneur in me with great exposure to managing projects in an emerging corporate landscape. VIT Bhopal University aims at creating highly intellect business mind-set, promote best business practices and innovative techniques to attain desired organization goal and contribute to nation s economy at large. Yashasvi Leve BBA, 2018-2021

title: BS | Faculty - VIT Bhopal
content: Dr. Prasad Begde Associate Professor and Dean i/c Email: prasad.begde@vitbhopal.ac.in, dean.vitbs@vitbhopal.ac.in Dr. Prasad Begde has a PhD, MBA, and BBA in Business Administration. He has more than seventeen years of teaching and research experience. Before joining VIT, he worked abroad for seven years. He worked as a faculty member with various universities and different countries and cultures, such as in India (Asia), the Republic of Fiji (Australian Territory), and Oman (Arabic Region). His previous institute, SUC College, Oman, is affiliated with Bond University, Australia, and his PG course is at Sunderland University, United Kingdom. He worked with the Fiji National University, Fiji, Sur University, Oman, and MITS Deemed University in India. His areas of teaching and research interest included Strategy, Entrepreneurship, Leadership, Marketing, E-Marketing, Consumer Behavior, Retail Management, Branding, and International Marketing. He has organised several National and International Conferences and is credited with research publications in various refereed journals. He has several journal publications with SCOPUS, ABDC listed peer revived Journals and National and International books such as Emerging Trends in Retail Management. He is on various editorial boards, such as the Chintan Research Journal and the IJBASS. He attended various teaching and professional development training program, including FDP from the Indian Institute of Management, Kozhikode (IIMK). He has several patents, such as DSS in Retail under Australian Patent Rights. He is also a member of various institutional and professional bodies, such as the IMRTC, USA, and Harvard Business Education. He also received the best professor award from IBA. He has guided various projects for bachelor s, master s, and PhD students in the management area. Dr. BHAKTI PARASHAR Assistant Professor Email: pc.bba@vitbhopal.ac.in Dr. Bhakti Parashar is a Doctorate in Economics from Bhopal University. She has done her M.Phil., M.A., and B.Com. from the same university. She has more than 12 years of experience in Institutes like ITM Gurgaon, IIM-Indore, MANIT-Bhopal, etc. Her area of specialization was on A Comparative Study of Rural and Urban Reproductive Health. and her area of research interest is the correlation between Economics & Social Sciences. Dr. Parashar has publications in reputed journals and has authored several book chapters. She has supervised more than 50 students for their internships and major projects. Dr. MANISHA SINGH Assistant Professor, VITBS Email: manisha.singh@vitbhopal.ac.in She has done her B.Com from Rani Durgawati Vishwavidyalaya, Jabalpur University, M.Com (pursuing) from Barkatullah University, MBA from Punjab Technical University and Ph.D. from Maulana Azad National Institute of Technology (MANIT) Bhopal. Her doctoral research focuses on Impact of Employer Brand on Employee Retention . She has having more than 13 years of experience in teaching and industry. Dr. Abhishek Raj Dr. Pankaj Kumar Assistant Professor, VITBS Email: pankajkumar@vitbhopal.ac.in Dr. Humaira Fatima Assistant Professor, VITBS Email: humaira.fatima@vitbhopal.ac.in Dr. Abdul Rashid Assistant Professor, VITBS Email: abdul.rashid@vitbhopal.ac.in Dr. Abdul Rashid is working as Assistant Professor in VIT Bhopal University. He holds a rich International teaching experience and served as Assistant Professor in a University in Gulf country. He also has industry experince of 3.5 years. He earned his four year full-time Ph.D. from Maulana Azad National Institute of Technology (MANIT), Bhopal. He qualified National Eligibility Test conducted by UGC India in 2013 and has been engaged with research in Retail Service Quality and Retailer Personality. He published several research papers in national and international Scopus indexed journals of repute and chapters in edited books. He was also awarded Fulltime Scholarship from Ministry of HRD, Government of India to conduct his research. He owns a total experience of 19 years including the industry, teaching and research. Being a passionate and hard working academician, he enjoys teaching different subjects of marketing specialization and has attended numerous National and International Conferences and Workshops, Seminars, Facuty Development Programs and Certificate Courses in India and abroad. Dr. Rajendra Mahanandia Assistant Professor, VITBS Email: rajendra.mahanandia@vitbhopal.ac.in Dr.Rajendra Mahanandia is the Assistant Professor at the VIT Business School Bhopal University, India. Dr. Mahanandia is a Doctorate from the School of Management Studies, University of Hyderabad. His Ph.D. thesis is entitled on the topic of A Study on the Corporate Sustainability Reporting Practices in the Indian Context. He completed his M.Phil. and PG in Industrial Relations and Personnel Management (IR&PM) from Berhampur University, Odisha. Master of Business Administration (MBA- General) from Pondicherry University (D). Dr. Mahanandia has a total of 5 publications in various reputed National and International journals in Scopus, ABDC (C), and UGC care listed. During his doctorate journey, he has been associated with organizing International conferences and workshops. He has attended several FDPs and workshops from premier institutions in India and abroad. His area of interest is HR, OB, Sustainability, SHRM, Marketing and Labour Law. Dr. Kavitha Rajayogan Assistant Professor, VITBS Email: kavitharajayogan@vitbhopal.ac.in Dr. Kavitha Rajayogan is Assistant Professor at VIT Business School with over 14 years of teaching and research experience in the domains of Marketing and Systems. She holds a Ph.D. in Marketing from Sathyabama Institute of Science and Technology in 2022, where her doctoral research focused on the Acceptance and adoption of technology in e-shopping among consumers in Tamil Nadu. She has completed her MBA in Systems from Anna University in 2007 and a B.E. (Computer Science and Engineering) from Anna University in 2005, providing her with a unique interdisciplinary foundation that blends management principles with technological insights. She actively adopts innovative pedagogical approaches and has enhanced her teaching competencies through FDPs, NPTEL, ATAL, Coursera, and IIT BombayX certifications. She has published 15+ papers in international journals, including Scopus-indexed and UGC-listed journals, and has contributed to national journals and international conferences. She has received best paper award for an international conference during 2021 and also received an appreciation letter for organizing training programme Computer literary to Youth and community members of Pudhu Vaazhvu Project during 2012. Her academic interests include Marketing Management, Operations Research, Production Management, and Business Analytics. Dr. Pankaj Jha Teaching Fellow Email: pankajkumarjha@vitbhopal.ac.in Dr. Pankaj Kumar Jha is a management academic and startup mentor specialising in entrepreneurship and innovation. He holds a Ph.D in Management (2026) from Pondicherry University, an MBA in Banking Technology, and a B.E. in Computer Science. His work integrates rigorous academic research with practical industry engagement, reflected in scholarly publications on product innovation and startup incubators, best-paper awards at national and international conferences, and 3.5 years of industry experience. He is actively involved in mentoring ventures, advising on strategy, sustainability, technology adoption, and market scaling, and has also served as a Research Assistant on an ICSSR-sponsored Minor Research Project. His academic and teaching interests include entrepreneurship, entrepreneurial finance and economics, startup ecosystems and incubation, project management, management information systems, decision support systems, enterprise resource planning, business and financial management, business finance, and banking theory and practice.

title: BS | Industry Experts And Collaborations - VIT Bhopal
content: The first session of the Expert Talk series, organized by the Business School VIT Bhopal University, witnessed an energetic and insightful talk by Shri K.K Nair, Registrar In-charge of VIT Bhopal University. The students of the Business School attended the lecture by Shri K.K Nair where he discussed the Prospectus of BHEL . The talk revolved around the different dimensions and product markets in which BHEL operates. He enlightened the attendees with insight into the research & development activities of BHEL along with the activities conducted at the corporate level of R&D division at Hyderabad, which leads BHEL s research efforts in numerous areas as well as the importance to BHEL s product range. The Expert Talk series continued with the talk of Mr. Vineet Saxena, a successful entrepreneur in the field of gem stones. He is a first-generation businessman and has an experience of more than two decades in the field of gemstones and jewelry. He shared his experience of the hardships he faced growing up. He discussed about the possible business opportunities and raised awareness among the students on launching a startup. It really motivated the students to strive for success no matter what their hardships or what the financial or social conditions are. A guest lecture was organized on the theme Personality Development on 13th December 2019. The lecture was taken by eminent trainer Mr. Siddhant Singh. All the business school students attended the session. The trainer imparted the lecture on the role of training in developing the personality and skills of the business students. The guest lecture was organized by Dr. Brahmadev Panda of business school. A corporate talk was organized on insurance management on 16th December 2019 in the business school. The session was taken by Mr. Chain Singh, Territory Manager (MP and CG) of Max Bupa Insurance Company. The session broadly covered the various risks covered and returns gained from the insurance policies of MAX Bupa Insurance. The corporate talk was organized by Dr. Brahmadev Panda of business school.

title: Outdoor to Indoor Education always finds a Way â€“ The Online Era - VIT Bhopal
content: In the last few decades, the mode of education has entirely reinvented itself repeatedly to evolve and adapt to the changes that we as a community have also undergone. It is beyond doubt that Learning Methods change as we learn and experience and the role of the Internet has been a huge influence on various such changes. From a non-existent system to being a network providing the largest most accessible database for information ever created, changing the way people communicate, gain knowledge, socialize, shop and earn on the Internet, all of which has seen a remarkable growth. Consequently, the mode of education has also evolved, now distance learning has become a reality through virtual classrooms and easily accessible online databases. A testament that Education always finds a Way The Online Era has become a reality and is here to stay and revolutionize the education system. Online Education has emerged as a New Normal today which portrays a relaxed and cost effective mode of learning with least effort and yet completely effective from either point of view the teacher and student. Being an education mode where the students use their home computers and the internet for a more non-traditional take on academic life, and has many advantages. This style has made online graduations, online courses etc. even more popular with the use of a number of digital media platforms and technologies. This computer/web based training is a flexible and versatile instruction delivery system that can encompass any kind of learning that used to take place in the real world before. Online learning provides educators an opportunity to reach out to students who may not be able to enroll into a traditional classroom course and, supporting students who need to work on their own schedule and pace. The quality of distance learning has tremendously improved with the necessity that we face today due to the pandemic. Many schools and institutes that offer online learning have increased rapidly. With almost infinite ways to teach and learn outside of traditional classrooms and away from college campuses online education is the best option dare I say even before the circumstances forced us. All you need is electricity and internet access and you get audio, video, text, animations, virtual training environments, live chats etc all at the tip of your fingers. This is what we refer to as rich learning with versatility that one can t find in traditional classrooms as it brings out the full potential on either side with least expenditure in terms of money, time or effort fully online degrees earned from the comfort of your home with no required visits to your college or university campus, libraries etc; what an opportunity to learn from anywhere! What you call and refer to as a drastic change, we call adaptive capability and evolution in the times of need. And things always get better when the majority depends on something. With the increase in online based activities around the world we have seen rapid growth in the field to facilitate its use to the vast multitude. For a country like India, as the Internet reaches the rural areas, doors to good education, better economic opportunities and effective healthcare systems, open and eventually aid the development of the country. Let s see the advantages of venturing into the online platform Reduced expenses The huge plus of online education would be the dip in money spent. Money requirement would minimize for classes, hostels, mess fees, activity fees, text books, membership fees and other random expenses. Online learning being an indoor method, there s no cost of commuting, assorted costs related to transport such as fuel, parking, vehicle maintenance, and public transportation costs etc. At the end of the day you seem to save money, time and in most cases, the environment as well. This will release the students from any and all burden in terms of debt and other criteria as well. With online classes, you re paying for the university credits while saving money. Reduced Load The intensity of every activity is significantly reduced; taking classes in the traditional way requires getting ready and showing up at a particular time every single day, sitting through a lengthy lecture class after class. If you space out, you lose the entire knowledge you ought to have gained in that class and there is little freedom compared to that at home. With online education, one chooses his/her own timing, can record sessions and catch up whenever possible, understand at your own pace, take snack breaks whenever wanted, stretch out and learn in comfort & style. All this reduces a good amount of load, unburdening an individual from great many things. 100% Attendance It doesn t matter where you live, it could be a downpour, it could be snow, or even a storm that stops you from getting up and walking out to get to class, because the class comes to you when it s online learning. All at the comfort of your very own home, attending classes online is as simple as switching on your computer, opening your laptop or even unlocking your smartphones/tablets. No rain soaked walks to and fro, no hypothermic marches, no sweaty hot days just you and your mind focused on learning at the comfort of your home. Additionally, you can be flexible about when you get things done, at your own leisurely manner as you create your own timetable. Students who juggle their careers and school will have a lot more freedom because they aren t tied down to a fixed schedule. All this reduces exhaustion relatively and it wouldn t matter if you are an early bird or a night owl, you can always have a 100% attendance with ease. Better Teacher Student Communication In some ways, even if the distance is greater, this method brings the students closer to their professors. You might not be physically present in class, but you can get easier access to any faculty whenever you need. In online classes you will always get your questions answered unlike traditional classes, this is because you can email them directly and eventually you will get a reply. This also helps the professors because they can record a class and post it online instead of streaming live and answer the questions while the session is being played through direct messages. Online communication emphasizes individual attention greater than the traditional method as it is easier to communicate with larger groups and the physical energy used is far lesser as the professors don t have to stand for long hours etc. Any College, Any Location You can get accredited while studying from home, attending exams from home, doing everything from home and get the degree from home; so, how does it matter where the college is located? The answer is it does not! Your choice university might have not been possible because it wasn t at your hometown or was too far away from it. But with online learning, it is possible now. There won t be anyone who is homesick from being away from home for too long at your hostels etc, because now you re doing it all from home. With this online mode of education, one can travel around the globe to get a degree while being where you are right now. There s no more Location Dependency factor to rule over your choice of university. A degree from any university, anywhere in the world, is now at your reach in this Online education era. Learning some Tech Skills There are plenty among us who have never been tech savvy or anything close to resembling computer skills within us. The most important skills that employees currently lack would be computer and technical skills. Of those reporting that they needed skills for their current job, 33% reported lacking technical skills, including basic computer skills. The online education system will push you to leave your comfort zone entirely and learn some basics and more to have some digital sense to thrive in this digital world. You will learn to navigate through portals, understand various online terms, surf through online course lectures, download materials, interact with other people online, communicate digitally and more all of which will become an extension of yourself with some practice and all these will come handy in your future as well as everything is bound to become more digital oriented, not less. Keeping pace with the evolving world is always a necessity and this is just one of many ways to achieve that pace. In conclusion, Online Education or Online Learning is a proven fantastic choice with no boundaries. Your email address will not be published. title: A peek into Life at VIT Bhopal - VIT Bhopal
content: Our Journey from the very beginning as one of the leading educational influencers was to always take a unique approach, creating the perfect balance between academic influence and extracurricular affluence to provide the complete package necessary for every VITian. The core vision of VIT is to impart futuristic technical education and instil high patterns of discipline to satisfy global standards by being technically superior and ethically strong is also the real depiction of Life at VIT Bhopal. Through the relentless efforts in pursuit of excellence, as per NIRF 2020 ranking, VIT is among the premier higher education institutes of India, which offer the right opportunities to excel in technical education. It is regarded as the best university in terms of providing new innovative programmes that keep pace with the changing technology scenario and prepare a globally competent generation of professionals. Taking forward this VIT legacy, VIT Bhopal was established in the year 2017, with an objective to empower its students to attain excellence through learning and aligning them with the current trends in technology. The cultural diversity in the student community, envisioning the best for every student, by giving them the VIT edge and providing every student a place to learn and a chance to grow; is the main goal for all the VIT Institutes in India. VIT Bhopal assures to all its students an exposure to cutting edge technology and provides them with immense career opportunities in terms of better placements in India and abroad, or gives them opportunities to pursue higher education in the top ranked universities of the world. Currently offering UG, PG, Integrated & Research programmes in the fields of engineering, applied sciences, technology, management etc., the University keeps itself closely informed about the latest developments and needs of the industry, hence designs courses that ensure employability of its students. All this is made possible with the integration of various features considered a necessity to bring out the maximum potential in every individual. The salient features of VIT Bhopal University are: A lush green futuristic campus of 250 acres with state of the art infrastructure spread over 10 lakh sq.ft. A novel method of learning Collaborative & Active Learning through Technology (CALTech) which enables peer learning through interactive demonstrations, projects and case studies. Futuristic laboratories and studios for students to learn by doing and acquire industry relevant practical knowledge in their respective specializations. The first ever integrated Lecture and Laboratory learning platform in the country with sophisticated classrooms without blackboards and back benches, that integrates technology, aesthetics, nature and psychology to enable student creativity to flourish. Fully Flexible Credit System (FFCS) empowers students with freedom to choose courses, faculty and the pace of study. Multitude of digital learning platforms to enable interactive learning that enhances theoretical understanding and stimulates out of the box thinking. VIT has a legacy of matchless placements and has been listed in Limca Records for the 8th time. The University has a central placement system for all campuses through the VIT placement cell. With a firm belief that a sound mind resides in a sound body, adequate indoor/outdoor sports facilities are provided in the campus. Offers a plethora of co-curricular and extracurricular activities to augment student s educational experiences. Well-resourced library with latest online databases and international titles for future ready courses. India s first campus with 100% Doctoral Faculty, which brings diverse and international expertise. Separate hostels for boys and girls, with lush green surroundings which offer the most conducive environment to students for healthy living and better learning. As an ever growing and evolving entity, the institute has always adopted and adapted to various circumstances including the pandemic situation we face currently. All our resources and compiled effort goes towards making things possible, adjusting to the choices we face and bringing about the right kind of change needed. One such example, in the current pandemic situation was the remarkable start of the HACKOVIT-2020 According to UNESCO, around 1.3Billion students across the world were not able to attend School/College/University as of March 2020 due to the current COVID scenario. And during this demanding situation, the School of Computing Science and Engineering (SCSE) at VIT Bhopal has successfully organized an online National Level Hackathon Hack CoVIT 2020 on the 1st of May2020. The primary objective of the event was to identify and promote applications to help people in the aftermath of the global pandemic. HackCoVIT2020 invited students up to UG level to participate and exhibit their skills. With an overwhelming response from students from all across the country, participation from 127 institutions across 19 different states made this event a massive success. The jury members included brilliant minds from Google, Microsoft, Philips,Thomson Reuters,Robert Bosh,Payoda Technologies,thought-works,and Stealth mode. Apart from providing the best in academics, a number of extracurricular activities, such hackathons, idea-thons etc. are conducted to encourage, inspire and nurture young students. Few of our other initiatives include the following: VIT BMUN, which organizes the national level Parliamentary Debate named SANSAD keeping in mind the decorum and true spirit of a Parliamentary Debate, where student participants debate on some general issues as well as issues concerning the nation and present their take on the same. Taking part in what truly matters now though vital experiences at the MUN fosters hopes of doing the same in the future VITronix Club This club has been initiated to push the ever curious student engineering minds to solve real world problems and help in developing promising and sustainable solutions for the betterment of the society. Applying the skills learned into various practical implementations to improve the state of pollution, defence, surveillance, smart farming, and many more. NSS Camps These special camps are organized generally on various developmental issues of national importance, letting the students and other youth to work along with the adults in rural areas, thereby developing their character, social consciousness and commitment, discipline and healthy and helpful attitudes towards the community. Other activities such as the Photography, Arts, Theatre performance, athletics etc also have their respective clubs/groups to embark on. The world today is becoming too complex and dynamic as new technologies continue to proliferate. Today there are hardly any careers that are untouched by technology. Most of the jobs require some state of the art technology skills to be developed, in this ever evolving new world. To cater to these changing technology paradigms VIT Bhopal, offers specialization in a wide range of fields like Mechanical, Bioengineering, Aerospace, Cyber Security & Digital Forensics, AI and Machine Learning and Gaming Technology at Undergraduate and Postgraduate levels. We at VIT Bhopal stay thoroughly up to date focusing on upcoming fields in engineering, thereby providing a wide range of opportunities. The entirety of the curriculum offered in these programmes is envisioned to meet the standards worldwide now and for the years to come, giving more opportunities to the students graduating. With qualified and trained faculty, support from major Industries like the Volkswagen, Virtual Engineering etc., practice of CALTech (Collaborative and Active Learning through Technology) which includes presentations, projects, workshops and regular assignments for both theoretical and practical knowledge and FFCS (Fully Flexible Credit System) which allows every student to plan their pace of study at the institution, VIT Bhopal proves to be the best academic destinations. The extent of International Collaboration at VIT includes signing multiple MoU s with foreign universities to boost the advancement of education, promote scientific research to improve the wavelength between the students and faculties. Our keen focus has always brought out the best results, a student of the 2018-2022 batch, Jasjeev Singh has been given an offer by Roach Interactive, India of Rs. 6 Lakhs based on his project work demonstrated in August 2019. Not only this, many students from the 2019-2023 have developed games in their first semester which are now available on various platforms such as the play store. VIT Bhopal has doctorate faculty and futuristic infrastructure which includes Coding studios, Computer labs, Gaming studio, library with latest online databases and international titles, availability of VR sets exclusively for the students of gaming technology. The Gaming Department of VIT Bhopal has signed MoUs with Unity Asia Pacific for Gaming, UI Path (USA) for RPA/Coding, Roach Interactive for Game Design and Full Sail University. These MoUs provide our students with many learning opportunities and help them to stay up to date with the world outside the institution as well. Marching towards academic excellence, VIT Bhopal also takes intrepid steps to nurture innovations and promote research activities. CyVIT, the Annual Cyber Security Conclave in association with National Cyber Safety and Security Standards-New Delhi, is the signature annual event of VIT Bhopal University. The event is focused to foster the exchange of ideas, insight, and technology among the pioneers of the academic and IT security industry. This is India s one of the largest Cyber Security conclaves, hosted exclusively for cyber experts along with professionals working in this field all over the world. The event provides a unique opportunity to hear from Cyber experts and scientists sharing the latest research in cyber-security. This premier event is exclusively designed to create a mutual platform for experts and the public to come together and share knowledge on one pestering issue cyber-crime and how to remain within the boundaries of cybersecurity. VIT Bhopal thrives to perfection with every passing year through its compiled work force which has always been focused on creating a fluid transition of students from their theoretical learning to practical execution by implementing various experiences through key services and support in all arenas of learning. title: CALTech â€“ The soul of teaching, learning process at VIT Bhopal Business School - VIT Bhopal
content: VIT Bhopal commenced operations in 2017 with Engineering and Business being the twin areas of study, teaching and research. Two of the most important distinctive features of VIT Bhopal are the presence of 100% doctoral faculty and the emphasis on the novel Collaborative Active Learning through Technology- CALTech, as the prime method of teaching learning. The word CALTech is a novel terminology coined by the illustrious Assistant Vice-President, Ms. Kadhambari S Viswanathan. In the education arena it is commonly accepted that peer-to-peer learning is one of the most effective methods of long lasting learning behaviour. This understanding has led to the creation of studio based class-rooms at VIT Bhopal, wherein students are made to sit around round tables in groups of 6 to 7. This enables them to interact in groups, which results in better understanding of the group dynamics, when the teacher gives them a hands-on assignment. The word Collaborative comes from this aspect of the teaching learning method. Students collaborate with each other in the learning process. They also make and deliver presentations at the end of their group assignment which augments their public speaking skills as well. Traditionally the method of teaching involved the process of the teacher delivering a lecture and the students participating in passive listening only. It has been very well concluded that this process was sub-optimum. Under CALTech the lecturing mode is incorporated for only one third of the total delivery time and makes the students learn by doing things and activities for the remaining two-thirds of the time. Once a student gets involved in doing, his learning is more durable and he is totally engrossed in the entire process for the whole duration of the class. This is a much more effective method of conducting the instruction process. As a result the student here is no more a passive listener but is transformed into an active doer first hand, hence the word Active in the acronym CALTech. Last but not the least, technology has become ubiquitous in the modern day workspace and education is not an exception in this regard. At the VIT Bhopal Business School faculty are actively encouraged to use technology in their lecture delivery up to the most optimum level. There are tools like Power Points, Moodle, Wifi, Videos, Video-conferencing etc. which have become indispensable in the Business School. This explains the term Tech which implies technology in the acronym CALTech. While the learning process becomes more engaging and fulfilling for the students in the CALTech process, it places a different set of demands on the faculty to take sessions in this mode. They have to come up with meaningful activities designed to impart to the students, the desired learning outcomes while keeping them thoroughly engrossed and engaged. It is very important that the activities are not disjointed and meaningless. They should flow from one to another in a seamless and smooth manner while being absolutely logical in their sequence. Small activities should form the building blocks of larger and more complex ones. They should lead to a sense of fulfilment in the minds of the students upon successful completion of the tasks. CALTech is such a process of teaching and learning which can be extremely rewarding to both the teacher and the taught. No doubt in the beginning the faculty has to put conscious efforts to train themselves in the CALTech mode but once achieved successfully it is extremely satisfying. At VIT Business school the entire team of the faculty puts all their sincere efforts in imparting knowledge to the students using the CALTech mode of teaching. One can claim that the faculty are using the method in all to its full potential. Some of the activities which are regularly followed at VIT Bhopal Business school, while delivering the lectures using CALTech are outlined below: The above are but a sample of the plethora of creative activities that can be employed in the field of business education while employing the CALTech mode of teaching and learning. At the VIT Business School the faculty are extremely motivated and actively involved in the CALTech method. They have become experts in this arena and leave no stone unturned in their quest for excellence as regards to this novel teaching learning methodology. At VIT Business School the faculty do not rest on their past achievement and believe that excellence is a never-ending process. They continuously work at stretching their boundaries and limits. The faculty are striving every day and are giving their students even-better learning experience every day. Perfection is an ever-elusive term but aiming at it leads to continuous improvement and can help in asymptotically approaching the same. Your email address will not be published. title: WHAT MAKES VIT BHOPAL DIFFERENT FROM OTHER UNIVERSITIES OF INDIA - VIT Bhopal
content: According to the UGC list issued in Feb2020, India has 935 universities and a number of university affiliated colleges and institutes. This creates confusion among the students to choose a college or university which can provide academic excellence and give them the best campus placement. Though most of universities promise to give 100% placements they hide their real conditions, and if they stick to their promise, soon the companies find candidates unfit for the post they are recruited for and are ultimately fired. One of the reasons behind this could be that most of the universities use traditional mode of teaching which is passive in nature; it imparts only knowledge but does not provide the expertise to incorporate this knowledge in the practical world. Universities like VIT Bhopal, encompasses techniques that make teaching learning method more effective and proactive, for effectively providing the required practical expertise to students which will be long lasting in their memory and helpful in their jobs as well. Conducting industrial visits, seminars, case studies, conferences, guest talks are a part of every business school of any institute which is not very useful to make student ready for campus placement and jobs. Collaborative and Active Learning through technology- CALTech, is the first and unique method used by VIT Bhopal that encourages students to be Active learners wherein they can troubleshoot, solve problems on their own, discuss, explain, debate or brainstorm over the results. Such interactions foster each and every student with confidence, faith and provide an encouraging environment to seek more knowledge. At VIT Bhopal Business school, in a typical 90 minutes class the faculty teaches for a maximum period of 30 minutes and for the remaining 60 minutes a topic based activity is carried out with active participation of all the students. Students actively participate which is not only the key to make them ready for corporate world but their pro activeness also inculcates leadership qualities in them which helps them succeed in their future careers. Summarizing, CALTech method of teaching learning seamlessly transforms every student from a passive learner to an active and subsequently a proactive learner.
